caption:
b'Home for the holidays! After spending 152 days at @hcahoustonhealthcare Clear Lake battling #COVID19, our caregivers were thrilled to celebrate with 36 year old Crystal Gutierrez as she headed home last week to reunite with her family for the holiday season.

Crystal was 36 weeks pregnant when she was admitted to the hospital with coronavirus in late June. She underwent an emergency cesarean section and gave birth to a baby boy. Crystal remained for two months in the intensive care unit, where she was hooked up to a life-support device called an extracorporeal membrane oxygenation machine, or ECMO, and underwent a tracheotomy. Months later, after defeating the odds, Crystal is excited to be home with her husband, Rafael, and their four sons.

We are extremely proud of our caregivers who work hard to ensure positive outcomes for patients like Crystal. Leaving the hospital to applause, cheers and well wishes from her caregivers turned family, Crystal said: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve been blessed with a second chance.\xe2\x80\x9d 

Crystal, thank you for allowing us to be a part of your homecoming. We\xe2\x80\x99re rooting for you every step of the way as you continue on your road to recovery. 
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HealthierTomorrows #Coronavirus #Hospital #Healthcare #Pandemic #Houston #Texas #Hope #Recovery #Home'

b'Gloves, masks, gowns and face shields. Every day, we suit up in personal protective equipment (PPE) to care for you. You have our commitment. 

Now we need yours. We encourage each and every one of you to help us slow the spread of #COVID19. #MaskUp and help us #SpreadKnowledge and #SaveLives.
.
.
.
#Healthcare #Hospital #Coronavirus #Pandemic'

b'While #VeteransDay observances this year looked different in light of the ongoing #COVID19 pandemic, HCA Healthcare colleagues at Regional Medical Center Bayonet Point in Hudson, Florida ensured that veterans under their care were properly recognized. :United_States: 

As they unlocked the stories of patients who have selflessly dedicated their lives to protecting our country in peace and wartime, they came across transitional surgical unit patient Joe Clark. Mr. Clark, a World War II veteran, was assigned to the 79th, 315th Company D \xe2\x80\x93 a group who was a part of the advancing force on D-Day. Wearing military recognition apparel, hospital colleagues paid homage to Mr. Clark \xe2\x80\x93 a veteran, purple heart recipient and prisoner of war. His family, including Mr. Clark\xe2\x80\x99s son who also served in the military, proudly joined the observance. 

It is a great privilege to help heal heroes like Mr. Clark. Today and every day we send heartfelt appreciation to all veterans and their families for their sacrifices to defend our freedom.
.
.
.
#TBT #CareLikeFamily #Veteran #Hospital #Healthcare #Coronavirus #Florida'

b'#2020 has been a tough year. But, our #HealthcareHeroes\xe2\x80\x99 dedication to the fight to care for their community has never wavered. Caregivers at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s Medical City Denton in Texas recently took part in a simple, yet solemn, remembrance rock ceremony to honor their \xe2\x80\x9cwhy\xe2\x80\x9d and to help us see light in the midst of an unfathomable year. 

"It was important for us to have a ceremony that helps us all; to stay connected to our \xe2\x80\x98whys\xe2\x80\x99 and not only remember those we've lost but be hopeful for those we continue to care for," said Lana Bamiro, a respiratory therapist and the hospital's director of cardiopulmonary services & imaging services.

Lana took part in the ceremony - placing a rock and also painting one with a message. "The one I painted was a heart and for me, as a respiratory therapist, we serve not only the lungs but also the cardiac side of things. So, the heart is where the lungs feed into and the heart pumps out to the rest of the body. So, it was truly significant to have the heart placed on my rock," Lana explained at the :link: in bio. 

To Lana \xe2\x80\x93 and all of our colleagues \xe2\x80\x93 we send our deepest #Gratitude to you. Thank you for your unprecedented levels of care, compassion, integrity, teamwork and innovation. 
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #CaringDuringCOVID19 #Pandemic #Honor #Denton #Texas #NorthTexas'

b'Bariatric surgery enables people to live longer, healthier lives, and helps to resolve obesity-related medical issues such as diabetes, high blood pressure, cardiovascular disease and sleep apnea. And now, patients are seeking weight loss surgery to combat a major #COVID19 risk factor: obesity.
 
Amanda Kines-Phillips, a 37-year-old mom from Georgia, started looking into her options during the pandemic. Knowing her increased risk of COVID-19, she wanted to make being healthy for her kids a priority. She opted for a mini gastric bypass surgery this summer under the care of Dr. Michael Snyder at @healthonedenver\xe2\x80\x99s Denver Center for Bariatric Surgery. Four months later, she lost 55 pounds.
 
Click the :link: in bio to read Amanda\xe2\x80\x99s story.
.
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #BariatricSurgery #WeightLoss #Healthcare'

b'Tuesday, December 1 is #GivingTuesday, a global generosity movement that supports and celebrates community organizations worldwide.
 
Uncertainty, financial pressures and global health challenges have made 2020 more difficult than we could have imagined. These challenges have impacted each and every one of us \xe2\x80\x93 and have left our communities in need, now more than ever. 
 
However you choose to give on Giving Tuesday \xe2\x80\x93 and every day \xe2\x80\x93 HCA Healthcare appreciates and celebrates how you care for your community.

:right_arrow_selector: Learn more at the :link: in bio. 
.
.
.
#HCACares #ImproveMoreLives #GivingBack #Giving'

b"According to the @americancancersociety, lung cancer is by far the leading cause of cancer death among both men and women. @sarahcannoncancer, the Cancer Institute of HCA Healthcare, is helping to combat this statistic by using \xe2\x80\x98gamer technology\xe2\x80\x99 :video_game: to aid in the early detection of lung cancer. 

Dr. Susan Garwood, pulmonologist and advanced bronchoscopist at Sarah Cannon Cancer Institute at @tristarcentennial, uses the technology to evaluate the smallest of abnormalities, giving us hope that we can diagnose cancers sooner and at an earlier stage.

\xe2\x80\x9cIf you have lungs, you can get lung cancer,\xe2\x80\x9d explains Dr. Susan Garwood. \xe2\x80\x9cSmokers, those who've stopped smoking and even those who've never smoked at all are susceptible to the disease. With this game-changing technology, HCA Healthcare is one step closer to beating lung cancer and giving all patients a healthier tomorrow.\xe2\x80\x9d
 
:right_arrow_selector: Learn more at the :link: in bio.
.
.
.
#ImproveMoreLives #HealthierTomorrows #LCAM #LungCancer #Nashville #Tennessee #Cancer"

b'Paying it forward. #ICYMI on @cbsnews HCA Healthcare nurses from @tulanehealthsystem in New Orleans spent Thanksgiving lending a hand to nurses at @research_medical_center in Kansas City, who are experiencing surges of #COVID19 patients.
 
For Tulane nurse Katie New, traveling to the Midwest was a way to repay kindness shown to her hospital as the pandemic began in the U.S. In April, 200 nurses from other HCA Healthcare hospitals flew to New Orleans to pitch in. "To be able to give them that relief that we know we received from them, it further locks in that nursing is a brother and sisterhood and I know that I chose the right profession," Katie said.
 
Click the :link: in bio to #WATCH the full interview.
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #HCANursing #CaringDuringCOVID19 #Nurses #Pandemic #Coronavirus #Hospital #Healthcare #KansasCity #NewOrleans'

b'Doctors, nurses and hospitals are the most trusted sources of information on critical healthcare issues, according to a survey from Jarrard Phillips Cate & Hancock. 

Trust us. The science is clear. Mask wearing saves lives. #MaskUp and help us #SpreadKnowledge and #SaveLives.
.
.
.
#COVID19 #Coronavirus #Hospital #Healthcare'

b"As we wrap up this week of thanks, we send our deepest gratitude to our patients. We are #Thankful for the trust that our patients have in us to always advocate on their behalf. This is a responsibility that we don\xe2\x80\x99t take lightly and it is at the heart and soul of what we do. Our patients\xe2\x80\x99 positive attitudes are endearing. Their strength inspires us to press on. And, we are proud to make a difference in people\xe2\x80\x99s lives every single day. 

People like Alice Langford. While receiving care at affiliate @henricodoctorshospital :hospital: in Richmond, Virginia, Alice\xe2\x80\x99s care team learned of her upcoming 106th birthday. They knew this incredible milestone deserved a proper celebration \xe2\x80\x93 complete with birthday cards, singing and a special red velvet cake. 

Thanks to Alice's determination and her care team's support, Alice was discharged shortly after her party and was able to spend the rest of her birthday at home.

Please join us in wishing Alice a happy 106th birthday! :birthday_cake::party_popper::balloon:
.
.
.
#FeelGoodFriday #CareLikeFamily #PositiveImpact #HealthcareHeroes #Richmond #Virginia"

b'Always working to give people a healthier tomorrow, our colleagues\xe2\x80\x99 response to 2020 has been nothing short of heroic. On this day of thanks, we pay tribute to all of our talented and caring team members who have come together to combat the pandemic and advance healthcare. For your strength, dedication and resilience today and every day \xe2\x80\x93 thank you.\n\nFrom the HCA Healthcare family to yours, we hope you all have a healthy and safe Thanksgiving holiday! #Thankful :fallen_leaf:'

b'They lift us up. We\xe2\x80\x99re #Thankful for all of the ways our communities have come together to show gratitude for frontline HCA #HealthcareHeroes. 

From donating meals :fork_and_knife_with_plate: to clapping :clapping_hands: from balconies to celebrities singing :musical_score: heartfelt songs \xe2\x80\x94 these extraordinary gestures have fueled our resolve and put the best of humanity on display.

:right_arrow_selector: Read on to see how our communities have lifted our spirits and brought us joy over the past several months at the :link: in bio.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #InThisTogether #Thankful #Thanksgiving2020 #Frontlines #EssentialWorkers #EMS'

b':drop_of_blood::wrapped_gift:Looking for the perfect gift this Black Friday? Give the gift of life and donate blood. 

#COVID19 has led to the cancellation of various community and office blood drives that are relied upon \xe2\x80\x93 and \xe2\x80\x93 hospitals across the nation are experiencing critical needs for blood donations. Every time you donate blood, you can save up to three lives: including accident and burn victims, heart surgery and organ transplant patients, and those battling cancer. 

We\xe2\x80\x99re #Thankful to each and every one of you who have rolled up a sleeve to donate blood during the pandemic and hope that others join our fight to save lives by scheduling a donation appointment today. Check out first-time donor Olivia Tyra\xe2\x80\x99s story as she heeded the call to help blood shortages at a drive held outside of @cartersvillemedical at the :link: in bio. 
.
.
.
#ImproveMoreLives #GiftOfLife #BlackFriday #DonateBlood #Thanksgiving'

b"They give us hope. During this week of gratitude, it\xe2\x80\x99s never been more fitting to honor our colleagues \xe2\x80\x93 each and every one of you \xe2\x80\x93 who have given their all to ensure HCA Healthcare patients receive the quality care they expect and deserve.

Today, our colleagues are being challenged like never before, yet remain focused and positive, always working toward a healthier tomorrow for the communities we serve. Their resilience is what keeps us all going. It's what makes us.

And, for that we are\xe2\x80\xa6#Thankful. 
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HealthierTomorrows #Gratitude #Hope #HealthcareHeroes #COVID19"

b'The pandemic has hit our world hard. Through it all \xe2\x80\x93 our doctors, nurses, specialists and colleagues show up to care and improve human life. You have our commitment. :right_arrow_selector: Now we need yours.
.
HCA Healthcare and more than 100 other top healthcare systems across the U.S. are uniting to encourage each and every one of you to #MaskUp to slow the surging COVID-19 pandemic now. We all must be vigilant in the behaviors that will protect us, our families, our communities and the ones caring for them.
.
Click the :link: in bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#LetsKeepItUp #LetsAllMaskUp #HealthierTomorrows #Coronavirus #COVID19 #Pandemic'

b'At HCA Healthcare affiliated hospitals, survival rates of #COVID19 patients has improved by 28% from April to September. NATE C-ARDS, a technology system created by HCA Healthcare, has helped coronavirus patients spend four fewer days on ventilators. NATE C-ARDS provides hospital clinical teams improved access to clinical information and proven protocols for patients with acute respiratory distress syndrome due to COVID-19.
.
"For patients with similar lung injury at the time of ventilation, the introduction of NATE C-ARDS resulted in greater adherence to best practice protocols, in turn resulting in decreased mortality and shorter length of stay on ventilators,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dr. Jonathan Perlin, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s chief medical officer and president of clinical operations.
.
:right_arrow_selector: Click the link in bio to view the full @wsj story.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #ImproveMoreLives #Pandemic #WallStreetJournal #Hospital #Healthcare #Ventilators'

b'Sweet dreams. You can sleep soundly knowing that rigorous infection control measures have been put in place to ensure our facilities remain safe places for you to confidently seek care during #COVID19. 
.
Rest even easier knowing you\xe2\x80\x99re doing your part to protect those around you: continue to wash your hands, wear your mask and keep your distance. 
.
.
.
#SpreadKnowledge #SaveLives'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cYou all have a part of it \xe2\x80\x93 a part of my heart.\xe2\x80\x9d :blue_heart::orange_heart:
.
HCA Healthcare caregivers at @grandstrandhealth :hospital: in South Carolina recently had the honor of celebrating with former critical care trauma patient, Denys Leverett.  Just two months ago, Denys arrived by ambulance and was intubated by @horrycountyfirerescue and the @myrtlebeachfire. Due to the severity of his injuries, his chest had to be cracked open to resuscitate him \xe2\x80\x93 a procedure with a national survival rate of only 3-4%. 
.
After a week in the hospital, Denys was able to return home to finish his miraculous recovery. #WATCH as he reunites and shares a special message with \xe2\x80\x9chis team.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #FeelGoodFriday #CareLikeFamily #EMS #HealthcareHeroes'

b"Attitudes may change, but the science remains the same. Mask wearing saves lives. Keep doing what's right.
.
Join HCA Healthcare and other leading healthcare systems to #MaskUp and stay safe.
.
Learn more at the #LinkInBio.
.
.
.
#COVID19 #HealthierTomorrows #ImproveMoreLives #Pandemic"

b'Stronger together. Throughout the pandemic, HCA Healthcare colleagues shine as they continue to show up for our patients \xe2\x80\x93 and each other. When #COVID19 hit New Orleans in March, HCA Healthcare nurses from Kansas-City based @hcamidwest heroically raised their hands to join their fellow colleagues on the frontlines at sister hospital Tulane Medical Center in Louisiana. 
.
Now \xe2\x80\x94 in a true #CareLikeFamily moment \xe2\x80\x94@tulanehealthsystem nurses are returning the favor. Last week, the New Orleans nurses arrived to provide support and assistance to caregivers at @research_medical_center in Kansas City, Missouri as the virus resurges in the region.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cThe sisterhood and brotherhood within HCA Midwest Health is something I take great pride in,\xe2\x80\x9d said Suzanne Ford, vice president, nursing operations at HCA Midwest Health. \xe2\x80\x9cNursing is at the heart and soul of our organization, and watching the care, compassion and support each of our hospitals provide each other is simply incredible.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
To our colleagues who are facing surges across the nation \xe2\x80\x93 thank you for always working together towards a healthier tomorrow for the communities that we serve. Thank you for your courage to show up ready to face new challenges daily. Thank you for protecting vigilantly, giving selflessly and supporting one another tirelessly.
.
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #CaringDuringCOVID19 #YearOfTheNurse #HCANursing #Nurse #Coronavirus #Pandemic #NewOrleans #KansasCity #Louisiana #Missouri'

b'As 2020 comes to a close, it\xe2\x80\x99s safe to say that we could all use some holiday cheer. But with the number of #COVID19 cases on the rise across the nation, it\xe2\x80\x99s important to remain vigilant. While it might be hard to hear, that means the way we celebrate the holidays this year will be a little different.
.
Click the :link: in bio to hear from Dr. Carl Vartian, infectious disease specialist and chief medical officer at @hcahoustonhealthcare Clear Lake, as he weighs in on ways to safely celebrate the upcoming holidays and provides an important reminder for us to all do our part.
.
.
.
#FallHealthFacts #CareLikeFamily  #HealthierTomorrows #Holidays #Family #Celebrate #Vigilance #Thanksgiving'

b'#SpreadKnowledge and #SaveLives from your phone! :mobile_phone_with_arrow:
.
HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s MyHealthONE patient portal is a complete online healthcare platform where you may access your health information 24 hours a day conveniently from your desktop computer, laptop, tablet or smartphone.
.
Furthermore, MyHealthOne allows you to schedule appointments that fit your schedule with the best doctors for your specific needs, all from the comfort and privacy of your home during #COVID19.
.
Create an account at the :link: in bio! 
.
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #Pandemic #Convenience #OnlineAppointments #Scheduling'

b'#ICYMI on @cnn: :blue_heart::orange_heart:Love wins. And, for one HCA Healthcare patient \xe2\x80\x93 Henry Bell \xe2\x80\x93 his love story peaked in the hospital while the world battles #COVID19. One day before he was released from HCA Healthcare's Orange Park Medical Center :hospital: in Florida, Henry and his long-time love finally decided to tie the knot. The location? In the hospital parking lot surrounded by his resilient healthcare workers who helped save his life.
.
"Throughout the pandemic, our colleagues have done tremendous work on the frontlines," said Dr. Bradley Shumaker, chief medical officer at Orange Park Medical Center. "Witnessing Henry's remarkable recovery and being a part of this special moment was a great reminder of why they do what they do every day.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Henry is sharing his story in \xe2\x80\x9chopes there are more lives saved and there are more happy endings.\xe2\x80\x9d He continues, \xe2\x80\x9cPlease wear a mask and wash hands more often. Please keep your distance. This is a very serious infection."
.
Read the full story at the :link: in bio. 
.
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #CareLikeFamily #Newlyweds #JustMarried #Pandemic #Florida'

b":woman_technologist::desktop_computer::man_technologist:HCA Healthcare is continuously seeking new ways to give back and build stronger communities by leveraging our partnerships with national organizations, providing grants to nonprofits and encouraging our colleagues to give back via volunteer efforts. Recently a group of colleagues linked arms with tech volunteers from 30 business partners in the first-ever virtual Hack for the Community event. The virtual hackathon, championed by HCA Healthcare and the @nashtechcouncil, has encouraged us to do better, do more and improve more lives in Nashville and around the country. Over the course of 36 hours, the nearly 200 volunteers built websites, apps and other systems for 14 local nonprofit organizations.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cIn Nashville, we have a history of coming together and collaborating to help our community and neighbors,\xe2\x80\x9d said Brian Moyer, president and chief executive officer of the Greater Nashville Technology Council. \xe2\x80\x9cMost recently, we saw our community's dedication to helping each other on the eve of a pandemic and the aftermath of a tornado. I'm grateful to see our tech community come together again during this time of need to do what we do best for those organizations on the front lines who are helping our neighbors every day.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Click the :link: in bio to learn more about Hack for the Community.
.
.
.
#HCACares #PositiveImpact #HCATechnology #H4TC #Technology #GiveBack"

b'#DYK the X-ray was discovered 125 years ago this week? Every day, medical imaging and radiation therapy plays an important role in patient care. 
.
As we recognize this important advancement in healthcare, we celebrate the skilled professionals who safely operate these machines to provide superior care to our patients across the nation and in the U.K.
.
Happy #RadTechWeek to all of our wonderful #RadTechs! Thank you for your hard work, dedication and continual pursuit of our mission to care for and improve human life. 
.
.
.
#ImproveMoreLives #Xray #Healthcare #Hospital'

b':United_States:As we continue to honor and pay tribute to our #HCAVeterans this week, hear from two of our colleagues who served on the front lines as soldiers deployed in the Middle East. Kelli Wray, chief nursing officer at West Hills  Hospital and Medical Center in West Hills, Calif., and Joe Rogers, a medical intensive care unit charge nurse at @tristarsummit in Hermitage, Tenn. are now back on the front lines fighting a new battle closer to home: the #COVID19 pandemic.
.
Both veterans say their military training helped prepare them for what needed to be done when COVID-19 emerged as a health crisis in the United States.
.
To all of our veterans at HCA Healthcare and across the country, thank you for answering the call to serve our country and our patients.
.
:right_arrow_selector: Get the full story at the :link: in bio.
.
.
.
#PositiveImpact #Military #Veterans #VeteransDay #Healthcare #Pandemic #Deployment'

b'More resources. More solutions. More possibilities. As a learning health system, HCA Healthcare is continually researching and improving standards of care not just for ourselves, but for healthcare everywhere. 
.
Read up on how we\xe2\x80\x99re using our #COVID19 learnings and data to conduct research and create innovative tools that improve patient outcomes at the :link: in bio. 
.
.
.
#SpreadKnowledge #SaveLives #Pandemic #Research #Data #HCATechnology'

b'As flu season intersects with the #COVID19 pandemic, healthcare experts continue to urge the public to take action to protect themselves and others.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cWhile we wait for COVID vaccines to be broadly available, the flu remains the number one cause of vaccine-preventable death in the United States,\xe2\x80\x9d explains Dr. Jonathan Perlin, president of clinical operations and chief medical officer at HCA Healthcare. \xe2\x80\x9cBy getting your flu shot and following the CDC\xe2\x80\x99s advice to prevent the spread of COVID-19, you will be in the best position to protect yourself, your family and your community from illness this winter.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Help us #FightFlu and #MaskUp #LatherUp #SleeveUp. :face_with_medical_mask: :soap: :syringe: 
.
Click the :link: in bio to find out why the flu shot is critically important this year and what vaccine options are available.
.
.
.
#Flu #FluSeason #FluShot #FluVaccine #Twindemic'

b'Resilient. Servant leaders. Heroes. A member of the @usnavyreserve, HCA Healthcare nurse Krisjhle Munguia had two days\xe2\x80\x99 notice to pack her bags and board the U.S. Naval Ship Comfort this past March. She says, \xe2\x80\x9cWe are trained to handle any type of pandemic. Even though COVID-19 is new, I was prepared to accept the mission, so there was no hesitation.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
This year #VeteransDay\xef\xbf\xbc takes on additional significance, as we honor our colleagues \xe2\x80\x93 like Krisjhle \xe2\x80\x93 who bring their incredible military training, specialized skillsets and preparation for battle to work each day as we continue the fight against #COVID19. To all of the veterans, active-duty service members, guardsmen, reservists and military spouses at HCA Healthcare and across the country, thank you for your service. 
.
Click the :link: in bio to meet several HCA Healthcare veterans who are proudly serving our patients and communities.
.
.
.
#HCAVeterans #PositiveImpact #Gratitude #Veteran #Service #USA'

b'You face difficulty head-on. You defend healthier tomorrows. On this #VeteransDay \xe2\x80\x93 a day when we recognize and thank those who have dedicated their lives to protecting our nation through their service in the U.S. armed forces \xe2\x80\x93 we say thank you. 
.
Veterans, thank you for your servant leadership, resilience and all the ways you continue to serve our patients, fellow colleagues and communities. 
.
Happy Veterans Day from HCA Healthcare. 
.
.
.
#HCAVeterans #PositiveImpact #Gratitude #Veteran #Military #MilitaryFriendlyEmployer #Army  #Navy #AirForce #CoastGuard'

b'Teamwork in the face of #COVID19 has helped HCA Healthcare teams weather uncharted territory. Director of critical care services Kris Flippo says the pandemic has strengthened bonds at his hospital, @capitalregionalmc :hospital: in Tallahassee, Florida. \xe2\x80\x9cMy passion as a director is to see to the professional growth of my nurses so that they become the best they can be and deliver the best care possible,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kris. \xe2\x80\x9cIn my position, especially in this pandemic, I have had to lean on my staff and the staff leans on me. I have been at bedsides with nurses and staffing in to help assist. We are not leading by pointing, we are leading at their sides. And, a lot of times, leading means just listening.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Kris, whose career choice was heavily influenced by his grandmother \xe2\x80\x93 a nurse \xe2\x80\x93 notes that there have been triumphs in the midst of global tragedy. \xe2\x80\x9cIt is beautiful to see a patient who is admitted to our critical care unit improve and move to the progressive care unit and then undergo the final stages of treatment on our eighth floor and finally get to go home,\xe2\x80\x9d adds Kris. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cThese are big wins, and it is hugely gratifying to know that you did the right thing in restoring a patient\xe2\x80\x99s health.\xe2\x80\x9d 
.
.
. 
#CareLikeFamily #ImproveMoreLives #HCANursing #Nurses #Tallahassee #Florida #Care'

b'Throughout the week \xe2\x80\x93 in celebration of #VeteransDay:United_States: on Wednesday, November 11 \xe2\x80\x93 we\xe2\x80\x99re coming together to honor all those who have served. Thank you for your courage and for answering the call of duty. Thank you for the extraordinary sacrifices you and your families have made on our behalf. :military_medal:As we pay tribute to these heroic individuals, we\xe2\x80\x99re renewing our commitment to veteran causes aligned with our mission to care for and improve human life. In honor of Veteran\xe2\x80\x99s Day 2020, HCA Healthcare has made a $50,000 donation to @rebootrecovery, an organization working to win the fight against combat trauma by providing comprehensive support to military veterans and their families. For the past five years, REBOOT has been the recipient of a Veteran\xe2\x80\x99s Day gift from HCA Healthcare, totaling more than $300,000, which, in turn, has impacted more than 10,000 program participants.
.
A 2019 report from the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs indicates that the suicide rate for veterans was 1.5 times the rate for non-veteran adults. \xe2\x80\x9cPerhaps now more than ever, the mission of REBOOT Recovery and their commitment to assist our veterans, first responders and their families address and heal from service related trauma is critically important,\xe2\x80\x9d said Christopher Northam, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s vice president of telehealth, a REBOOT Recovery board member and veteran. \xe2\x80\x9cThis year\xe2\x80\x99s gift builds on our existing relationship and will help us revitalize virtual training materials, which are at the heart of REBOOT\xe2\x80\x99s work with veterans and first responders across the country.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
The resources provided by REBOOT are distributed across 254 locations both inside and outside of the U.S. and are supported by more than 1,200 community-based program volunteers. \xe2\x80\x9cMany recipients of REBOOT\xe2\x80\x99s services include individuals struggling with PTSD \xe2\x80\x93 who are at risk of suicide \xe2\x80\x93 so these programs are literally saving lives every day,\xe2\x80\x9d adds Northam. 
.
Click the :link: in bio to learn more about what HCA Healthcare is doing to support and employ veterans and their families.
.
.
.
#HCAVeterans #PositiveImpact #Veteran #PTSDAwareness #Heal'

b':laptop_computer::mobile_phone:Meeting you where you are. In the wake of the pandemic, HCA Healthcare is using telehealth to keep you safe and healthy in the fight against #COVID19.
.
By equipping our sites of care with telehealth options, our team is minimizing potential exposure and maximizing your care. From urgent care clinics to physician practices \xe2\x80\x93 across our organization we\xe2\x80\x99ve expanded telehealth capabilities to redefine healthcare and connect patients and providers virtually. 
.
.
.
#SpreadKnowledge #SaveLives #Telehealth #Healthcare #Pandemic #Coronavirus #VirtualHealth'

b':ring:#COVID19 can\xe2\x80\x99t stop love. After spending nearly two months at Orange Park Medical Center:hotel: in Florida fighting coronavirus, HCA Healthcare patient Henry Bell and his longtime fiance\xcc\x81, Antoinette Brown, finally said their vows in front of the hospital\xe2\x80\x99s rehab center in the presence of those who had helped to get him to the alter.
.
Henry was admitted with the virus on September 13 and was quickly put on a life-saving ventilator, spending weeks in the hospital\xe2\x80\x99s intensive care unit. Antoinette never lost hope. After coming off of the ventilator, Henry\xe2\x80\x99s first and only wish was to marry the love of his life. The couple did not want to wait another minute to say their \xe2\x80\x9cI do\xe2\x80\x99s\xe2\x80\x9d and insisted that a few special guests attend their ceremony \xe2\x80\x93 the caregivers that had turned family. \xe2\x80\x9cWe decided to do it now because we feel they [the hospital staff] are like family and wanted to share the life they gave us back,\xe2\x80\x9d said Antoinette. Our colleagues unanimously said \xe2\x80\x9cwe all do!\xe2\x80\x9d when the officiant asked \xe2\x80\x9cwho gives this woman to be married?\xe2\x80\x9d.
.
For Henry\xe2\x80\x99s caregivers, the wedding signaled hope and marked a new and incredibly meaningful way to celebrate COVID-19 recovery. \xe2\x80\x9cThe whole time he was just so excited to get better and get back to this family,\xe2\x80\x9d said speech-language pathologist Kaitlin Trueblood of her patient. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was awesome to see him be able to stand and get married.\xe2\x80\x9d #WATCH the special ceremony at the :link: in bio!
.
Congratulations, Mr. and Mrs. Bell!
.
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #CareLikeFamily #Wedding #Newlyweds #JustMarried #Florida #Recovery'

b':orange_heart:#Hope starts here. Our mission to care for and improve human life is amplified by the support given to HCA Healthcare colleagues in times of need through the HCA Healthcare Hope Fund. Over the past 15 years, we\xe2\x80\x99ve come together to help 39,000 fellow HCA Healthcare colleagues navigate some of life\xe2\x80\x99s most difficult moments.
.

b':lion_face: :tiger_face: :bear_face: Lions, tigers and bears \xe2\x80\x93 oh my! Every year, Shannon Younginer and Michelle Fulton, NICU nurses at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s @summerville_medical_center, create handmade Halloween costumes for their tiniest patients in hopes of making the holiday special for new parents and babies who will be spending their first Halloween in a hospital, rather than at home.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cWe try to make every day special for these babies, but even more so on holidays,\xe2\x80\x9d explains Shannon. \xe2\x80\x9cIf this thing that we do creates even just one smile, it is all worth it! We love our babies!\xe2\x80\x9d
.
This year, Shannon and Michelle spent more than 40 hours creating 18 handmade zoo costumes for the Summerville Medical Center NICU Zoo. :tiger::elephant::hippopotamus: In addition to the ornate costumes, they orchestrate a photoshoot, complete with a handmade backdrop, to commemorate baby\xe2\x80\x99s first Halloween. 
.
Shannon continues, \xe2\x80\x9cHalloween is our most favorite time to dress up our babies. Michelle and I work together to make handmade costumes for our babies when we are not at the hospital. This is so much fun for us!\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Thank you Shannon and Michelle, and all of our NICU nurses nationwide, who make sure our youngest patients properly celebrate their first #Halloween\xef\xbf\xbc.
.
.
.
#HCABabies #FirstHalloween #HalloweenCostume #Baby #NICU #Costume #HalloweenBaby'

b'Inhale. Exhale. They\xe2\x80\x99re the ones that literally give the breath of life to critically ill patients. It\xe2\x80\x99s a profession that is playing a fundamental role in the fight against #COVID19. And, those ventilators that we\xe2\x80\x99ve heard so much about? They\xe2\x80\x99re the guardians of the lifesavers on wheels.
.
:orange_heart::blue_heart:Help us celebrate #RespiratoryCareWeek2020 by thanking respiratory therapists (RTs) across the HCA Healthcare network for their tireless efforts and innovative contributions to patient care. 
.
RTs work with everyone from newborns to seniors, and work in many areas of the hospital from the emergency room to the intensive care unit to the operating room. They treat the related side effects of diseases, viruses and infections from severe colds and pneumonia to asthma, bronchitis, emphysema, lung cancer and now, COVID-19. In addition to managing these conditions, RTs respond to distress calls, intubations, assist with C-sections, high-risk deliveries and more.
.
:right_arrow_selector: Learn more about the respiratory care field and career opportunities to help the world breathe easier at the :link: in bio. 
.
.
.
#RTWeek2020 #RCWeek20 #UnlockPossibilities'

b':drop_of_blood::drop_of_blood::drop_of_blood: The gift of blood saves lives, and during #COVID19 the need for blood is now and ongoing: every 2 seconds someone in the United States needs blood. Blood and platelets cannot be manufactured \xe2\x80\x93 they can only come from volunteer donors. Enter HCA Healthcare colleague and @americanredcross volunteer Kurt Alexander, who plays a noble part in the nearly 21 million blood products transfused each year.
.
Kurt began by volunteering at blood drives to check-in donors, and \xe2\x80\x9cthrew his hand up\xe2\x80\x9d when asked to take on the larger responsibility of coordinating blood drives for HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s corporate campus in Nashville, Tenn. \xe2\x80\x9cI love the mission of Red Cross, so the opportunity was a no brainer!\xe2\x80\x9d said Kurt, a senior business IT analyst. Kurt\xe2\x80\x99s passion for serving his community deepened after seeing critical blood shortages during the pandemic. Nationwide, blood drives were cancelled in unprecedented numbers, yet Kurt pushed hard to safely organize the largest blood drives HCA Healthcare has seen in over a decade.
.
He says that the record breaking volumes would not have been possible without the help of his fellow colleagues, who sought to be a part of the solution. \xe2\x80\x9cExperiencing the solidarity of volunteering with my colleagues who recognize the need to help others is profound and encouraging,\xe2\x80\x9d says Kurt. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a reminder that in spite of what we do or where we come from, we\xe2\x80\x99re all focused on a single goal: improving human life.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Donors of all blood types are urgently needed to help restock the shelves. During HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s month-long Virtual Giveback initiative, join us and make a difference in the lives of others by donating blood. Click the :link: in bio to find a drive.
.
.
.
#VirtualGiveback #HCACares #ThankfulThursday #DonateBlood #Volunteer #BloodDrive'

b'This Saturday, October 24, approximately 95 HCA Healthcare facilities across 16 states will partner with local law enforcement agencies to collect unused and expired prescription medications at events across the country as part of our second annual \xe2\x80\x9cCrush the Crisis\xe2\x80\x9d opioid take back day.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cIn every community, people are losing their jobs, losing their families, losing their lives, because of opioid abuse, and I felt like I needed to act,\xe2\x80\x9d said Sara Stedman, a nurse at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s @tristarcentennial, who came up with the idea for \xe2\x80\x98Crush the Crisis\xe2\x80\x99 after witnessing the effects of opioid addiction. \xe2\x80\x9cThanks to the continuous support of HCA Healthcare and those across the country that participated, we\xe2\x80\x99re making a real impact by removing harmful drugs from our communities.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Click the :link: in bio to learn more about this year\xe2\x80\x99s opioid take back day and how you can help #CrushTheCrisis.
.
.
.
#TakeBackDay #HealthierTomorrows #HCACares #OpioidCrisis #OpioidAwareness #Opioid #Hospital'

b'The pandemic has shown the world the truth we\xe2\x80\x99ve always known \xe2\x80\x93 infection preventionists (IPs) are pivotal in safeguarding the health of our patients, colleagues and communities. From championing infection control practices to prevent the spread of #COVID19 to working hard to ensure caregivers wear their PPE correctly, 2020 has put IP heroes in the spotlight. 
.
This week, that light shines brighter as we honor International Infection Prevention Week 2020! Click the :link: in bio to hear from HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s chief epidemiologist, Dr. Ken Sands, as he wishes each of our colleagues a safe and celebratory #IIPW.
.
.
.
#IIPW2020 #HealthierTomorrows #InfectionPrevention #Hospital #PatientSafety'

b'Meet Sara Stedman, a nurse at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s @tristarcentennial :hospital: in Nashville, Tenn. where she cares for orthopedic patients as a nurse navigator to joint replacement surgeon, Dr. Jeffrey Hodrick. 
.
Passionate about making a difference in the fight against the opioid epidemic, in 2017 Dr. Hodrick and Sara launched an opioid stewardship program to study the prescribed use of opioids at the hospital, while noting that a significant number of opioid addictions and overdose deaths are the result of individuals\xe2\x80\x99 access to unused medications obtained from the medicine cabinets of family and friends. 
.
From their work, \xe2\x80\x9cCrush the Crisis\xe2\x80\x9d was born as a grassroots, community engagement initiative with the goal of creating greater awareness of the dangers of opioid misuse, while offering current and former patients the opportunity to return expired or unused pain medication for safe and proper disposal. In just three years, Sara and Dr. Hodrick\xe2\x80\x99s dream has spread from one hospital to 100 HCA Healthcare facilities in 2019 who partnered with local enforcement to host take back day events in 16 states. As a result, nearly 6,000 pounds of unused and expired medication \xe2\x80\x94 the equivalent of more than 4 million doses \xe2\x80\x94 were collected.
.
Learn more about Sara\xe2\x80\x99s story and the work being done to #CrushTheCrisis in 2020 at the :link: in bio. 
.
.
.

#OpioidCrisis #HealthierTomorrows #Opioids #Pandemic #Nashville #Tennessee'

b':party_popper: Congratulations to HCA Healthcare Chief Diversity Officer, Sherri Neal, for being honored by @tnhospitals during its virtual 2020 Annual Meeting. Sherri was awarded the Diversity Champion Award, which recognizes leaders who have made outstanding contributions in leadership and workplace diversity, equity and inclusion, and demonstrated commitment to a diverse workforce.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cSherri is a tireless champion of diversity, equity and inclusion for patients, colleagues and the larger community, with more than 25 years of experience as a diversity practitioner,\xe2\x80\x9d says Wendy Long, M.D., President and CEO of the Tennessee Hospital Association. \xe2\x80\x9cIn 2018, Sherri established the BRAVE Conversations Program at HCA Healthcare, which provides a forum for employees to share perspectives and discuss complex and challenging topics. The program received first place in the Profiles in Diversity Journal\xe2\x80\x99s annual Innovations in Diversity & Inclusion Award in 2018 and currently is being expanded across the company.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Sherri\xe2\x80\x99s passion for inclusion also extends to supporting veterans and military spouses and her team\xe2\x80\x99s efforts have earned HCA Healthcare a Military Friendly Employer designation from VIQTORY for the past 10 years and placed HCA Healthcare on the 2020 list of top organizations classified as "Better for Veterans." 
.
Thank you, Sherri, for your vision and ongoing efforts to drive positive changes for our patients, colleagues, suppliers, boards and communities. We are so INSPIRED!
.
.
.
#PositiveImpact #THAAnnual #WorkplaceDiversity #MilitaryFriendly #Veterans #Inclusion #Equity #Leadership'

b"Give back. Pay it forward. That\xe2\x80\x99s what our colleagues continue to do this month as part of HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s #VirtualGiveback. An emergency room nurse ambassador at affiliate Medical City Denton, Joanie Sackett gives through selfless acts of service and makes a positive impact on the North Texas community every single day.
.
Joanie volunteers at NEXT Steps Center, delivering weekly school supplies and notes of encouragement to teachers in addition to baskets full of staples to families just moving into her city. During #COVID19, Joanie has helped vulnerable elderly members of her community obtain food and has also assisted neighbors in need who are experiencing loss of income. She says the best part about volunteering is \xe2\x80\x9cseeing the faces of the people we deliver items to.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Joanie also serves as the sexual assault nurse examiner for Denton County and works alongside two other advocacy groups: @dcfof and Children's Advocacy Center for Denton County. With the help of HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s gift matching program, Joanie has helped these agencies provide free shelter, clothes, food and counseling to assault victims.
.
Thank you for caring for your community, Joanie. We are grateful for the passion you pour into people in need.
.
.

b"According to the @cdcgov nearly 250,000 women are diagnosed with breast cancer in the U.S. every year, but breast cancer isn\xe2\x80\x99t exclusive to women \xe2\x80\x93 men can get breast cancer too. With a critical care background and nearly a decade on the frontlines of cancer care, HCA Healthcare colleague Kyle Bryan knew a lot about cancer. He knew that cancer doesn\xe2\x80\x99t discriminate. Even then \xe2\x80\x93 the now Associate Chief Nursing Officer at Medical City Dallas Hospital :hospital: didn\xe2\x80\x99t recognize his own signs of breast cancer right away.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m sharing my story because I want everyone to be aware that this can happen to them,\xe2\x80\x9d says Kyle. \xe2\x80\x9cBe aware of changes in your body, even small ones, and if something seems off, get it checked. If I had caught it sooner, I may not have had to undergo chemotherapy and radiation. This has taught me such a lesson \xe2\x80\x93 now I don\xe2\x80\x99t delay anything in my life!\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Kyle\xe2\x80\x99s breast cancer journey is now the \xe2\x80\x9cwhy\xe2\x80\x9d behind his commitment to ensuring every patient who passes through our doors receives superior, patient-centered care. \xe2\x80\x9cHaving cancer really gave me another perspective,\xe2\x80\x9d shares Kyle. \xe2\x80\x9cNow I can actually say, \xe2\x80\x98Let me tell you what it was like to be on the other side,\xe2\x80\x99 and why we prioritize a compassionate experience as a meaningful mission.\xe2\x80\x9d 
.
Read Kyle's full story and learn more about @sarahcannoncancer, the Cancer Institute of HCA Healthcare, at the :link: in bio.
.
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #FightingCancerTogether #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth #BCAM #BreastCancer #MaleBreastCancer #Dallas #Texas"

b'A sendoff fit for a king! :crown: Little Russell Jr. and his parents recently left HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s @tulanehealthsystem\xe2\x80\x99s Lakeside Hospital :hospital: in grand style with a parade through the Metairie, La. hospital. Born at only 22 weeks and weighing barely a pound, Russell Jr. is the youngest baby to graduate from the hospital\xe2\x80\x99s neonatal intensive care unit (NICU). Neonatal doctors were in the room when he was born May 22 to begin saving his life as soon as it started.
.
Russell Jr. spent 133 days in the hospital growing stronger and now weighs seven pounds. After defying the odds, Russell Jr.\xe2\x80\x99s mother, Natasha, says she\xe2\x80\x99s looking forward to one day telling her baby about the people who helped him survive. \xe2\x80\x9cAs he grows, we will tell him stories of the dedicated nurses and doctors and staff members at Tulane Lakeside Hospital who helped a 22-week-old baby get to the point of coming home,\xe2\x80\x9d said Natasha. b"2020 is the most pivotal year in the HCA Healthcare Hope Fund's existence. When a natural disaster strikes and access to communication channels are disrupted, the HCA Healthcare Hope Fund enlists the help of colleague volunteers to reach out directly to colleagues in need of financial assistance to help them navigate the application process. By picking up the phone and providing a listening ear, our volunteers quickly discovered that our colleagues simply wanted someone to speak to who was willing to listen and understand what they were going through. 
.
According to Lara Henley, an information protection analyst with HCA Healthcare, this has been the most fulfilling work volunteer-wise. \xe2\x80\x9cWalking people through some of their most vulnerable moments makes me so grateful to work for HCA Healthcare. The drive to support the mission has been so apparent. Being able to be the light in someone\xe2\x80\x99s day has been so rewarding, it makes me smile just thinking about it.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
:right_arrow_selector: If you are a colleague impacted by #COVID19, illness, injury, domestic violence \xe2\x80\x93 or any of a number of unavoidable hardships \xe2\x80\x93 the HCA Healthcare Hope Fund can provide financial assistance. Get the full story and learn more at the :link: in bio.
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #CaringDuringCOVID19 #HCACares #FinancialAssistance #Volunteer #Tennessee #Hope"

b'Today, we\xe2\x80\x99re kicking off HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s Virtual Giveback. In 2020, the communities that we serve need us more than ever, with non-profit and community organizations playing a vital role in ensuring community needs are met in times of crisis. Our month-long Virtual Giveback initiative is a call-to-action for colleagues to be leaders and advocates by amplifying their giving and volunteer time. 
.
One such leader is Jyoti (Jo) Agarwal, a principal statistical programmer at @sarahcannoncancer, the Cancer Institute of HCA Healthcare. \xe2\x80\x9cI am inspired by a shared Sarah Cannon vision to save and improve lives of people fighting against cancer,\xe2\x80\x9d says Jo. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s more than work \xe2\x80\x94 it\xe2\x80\x99s a passion, and it\xe2\x80\x99s personal!\xe2\x80\x9d She\xe2\x80\x99s also enthusiastic about mental health and volunteers her free time to facilitate meditation workshops with her husband. The free workshops teach meditation as a way to help regulate emotions and be more resilient to stress. Through meditation, Jo is helping her community recharge, refresh, rejuvenate and nurture a deeper connection with others. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cOne of the greatest things a human being can do is to give of himself or herself to serve others. Whenever we give selflessly, unasked for, we end up having more. There is no greater joy that can fill our heart than giving,\xe2\x80\x9d Jo comments. 
.
Thank you, Jo, for giving it back and paying it forward \xe2\x80\x93 particularly during this year of heightened mental health challenges.
.
.
.
#VirtualGiveback #HCACares #CommunityDays ThankfulThursday #MentalHealth #Meditation #Volunteer #Community #Cancer'

b'#DYK? Each year, 1.7 million adults in America develop sepsis, and the condition claims the lives of 270,000 in the U.S. Most sepsis is caused by bacterial infections, but it can be a complication of other infections, including viral infections, such as #COVID19 or influenza.
.
Jessie Payton, a Sepsis and Quality Care Coordinator at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s @westvalleymed :hospital: in Caldwell, Idaho plays a critical role in hospital sepsis awareness, detection and care. Working alongside clinical teams to enhance our culture of safety, she helps improve patient outcomes by collecting and analyzing sepsis patient data. 
.
During #COVID19, Jessie\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to care like no other has not changed. In fact, it\xe2\x80\x99s heightened her focus to provide any support she can to fellow caregivers, including working hospital shifts, assisting with nurse leader rounding and working as a PPE Steward. "Working in healthcare during the pandemic has proven to be challenging and yet very humbling," said Jessie. "I have had the ability to witness our colleagues within this facility embrace teamwork whenever it is possible."
.
As #SepsisAwarenessMonth comes to a close, we recognize Jessie and all expert sepsis care champions across HCA Healthcare. Thank you for improving more lives in more ways through innovative best practices and technologies for recognizing and treating sepsis. 
.
.
.
#ImproveMoreLives #CaringDuringCOVID19 #HCASPOT #Sepsis #SepsisAwareness #Infection #Idaho'

b'Access to personal protective equipment (PPE), made available through our vast network of suppliers, ensures caregivers receive the resources they need to safely care for their patients during #COVID19. 
.
As the virus made landfall in the U.S., HCA Healthcare leadership created a multidisciplinary PPE task force at each of its 186 hospitals. The task force oversees adherence to CDC guidance related to PPE supplies and usage. At the head of each task force sits a PPE Steward, who is responsible for distributing the correct PPE on each floor as well as hearing from caregivers about specific needs. The Stewards also educate caregivers on how to safely put on and remove protective equipment, the different levels of PPE and its appropriateness to different tasks.
.
Click the :link: in bio to hear from several HCA Healthcare PPE Stewards on how they\xe2\x80\x99re ensuring a safe environment for colleagues and patients.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #PositiveImpact #PPE #COVID_19'

b'Victory for Victoria! Thriving in the face of her health hurdles, HCA Healthcare patient Victoria Mugo is an inspiration to us all.
.
Care teams at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s @medctrofaurora in Colorado expertly and quickly responded to save the Victoria\xe2\x80\x99s life last year. The then 38-year-old mother\xe2\x80\x99s body was under attack by sepsis \xe2\x80\x93 the body\xe2\x80\x99s extreme response to an infection. After coming close to succumbing to sepsis, Victoria underwent multiple limb amputations.
.
One year later, Victoria says she\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cgrateful for life\xe2\x80\x9d and is now using her fighting spirit and journey to help other sepsis survivors.

b"We are joining the @amermedicalassn (AMA) to celebrate Women in Medicine Month, which serves to showcase the accomplishments of women physicians as well as highlight advocacy related to women physicians and health issues impacting women patients. Today, we\xe2\x80\x99re shining a spotlight on Dr. Kimberly DeStefano, a maternal medical director at St. David's Women's Center of Texas. :hospital: Dr. DeStefano sees HCA Healthcare patients in both the office and hospital in an effort to maximize health for both mothers and babies alike. She enjoys the close relationships that she has with her patients and, during #COVID19, has helped to develop protocols for pregnant patients who develop the virus, and for the nurses and staff that provide care to them.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cThe opportunity to manage complex medical issues and improve outcomes for mothers and babies during such an important part of a woman's life is very rewarding,\xe2\x80\x9d says Dr. DeStefano. \xe2\x80\x9cHCA Healthcare is committed to improving outcomes for women and infants throughout the organization and has led the charge on many initiatives that have become national standard of care. Every person who works here, regardless of their role, is committed to serving and caring for the patient.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
When asked why she is proud to be a woman in medicine she replied: \xe2\x80\x9cFor me it is more than just being a woman in medicine, it is also important to be a leader in medicine. I believe that women bring a unique perspective and experience to both medical care and organizational leadership. Emotional intelligence is key to developing an approach to healthcare that incorporates the best medical advances with the understanding that human connection is an integral part of health and healing.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
From classrooms to clinics, thank you to all the strong and inspirational female providers and educators in medicine \xe2\x80\x93 like Dr. DeStefano \xe2\x80\x93 who continue to dedicate their lives to do and be better for themselves and for their patients. 
.
.
.
#RaiseTheBar #HealthierTomorrows #WIMMonth #WomenInMedicine #FemalePhysicians #MaternalFetalMedicine #HighRiskPregnancy #HCABabies #Care"

b'In the face of natural disasters and #COVID19, healthcare systems and hospitals need to be prepared to protect their patients and facilities. Dr. Jonathan Perlin, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s president of clinical operations and chief medical officer, spoke with HealthLeaders about our organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategy for disaster preparedness.
.
"One of the great advantages of the scale of HCA Healthcare is the ability to have a world-class emergency operations program. Operational plans are something that we think about 52 weeks a year," Perlin told HealthLeaders. "We approach every storm with humility. However fortunate we've been on the basis of prior preparation, we know that there may be unforeseen contingencies. We just feel that humility in the face of the uncertain is the best posture to respond to what might be new, what might be different, what may not be anticipated, in any particular emergency event."
.
With an Enterprise Emergency Operations Center that can be activated at a moment\xe2\x80\x99s notice, our goal is to always ensure our colleagues are safe and patient care remains uninterrupted. 
.
Click the :link: in bio to read the full article.
.
.
.
#HCAEmergencyOperations #ImproveMoreLives #Hurricane #Wildfire #DisasterPreparedness'

b'Just as a family does, we pull together to care for, support and celebrate with patients and each other. We couldn\xe2\x80\x99t be more proud to see 28-year-old youth director and #COVID19 patient, Casey Gray, WALK out of inpatient rehab last week, surrounded by the care team who fought hard for the life in their care. 
.
Casey was admitted to HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s Largo Medical Center in Florida after testing positive for the virus in July. He was placed on extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), an aggressive treatment for severe respiratory distress, for 39 days. HCA Healthcare nurse Kelly Mercer reflects on what it meant to #CareLikeFamily for Casey: 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cCasey, I remember taking care of you like it was yesterday. So many times, I thought, will you ever go home? I stood over you one Sunday and prayed. I begged whoever was listening to please help us save you.\xe2\x80\x9d After one of his lung procedures, Casey\xe2\x80\x99s journey miraculously took a turn in the right direction. \xe2\x80\x9cOne day, your oxygen levels rose, and your labs showed improvement. The next thing I knew, I went in and saw you, looking at me, mouthing words, and I made you stick out your tongue. We called Savannah, and she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t believe what was happening, and neither did we. A few weeks went by, and I saw you talking, walking the hallways and smiling. It was INCREDIBLE! You were our miracle. I get choked up every time I talk about you. You make every terrible day feel worth it because you made it! You made it, Casey Gray!\xe2\x80\x9d
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HealthierTomorrows #Florida #Recovery #Celebrate'

b':laptop_computer::woman_technologist::mobile_phone_with_arrow:Throughout #COVID19, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s Information Technology Group (ITG) stepped into action to help address the virus and flatten the curve. From rapidly connecting physicians with patients via telemedicine to facilitating heartfelt ways for patients to celebrate, mourn and communicate during a time of isolation \xe2\x80\x93 these innovations have changed the way patients are cared for forever. 
.
"In my forty years with HCA Healthcare, the reliance on the ITG department has never been more apparent than during the COVID-19 pandemic,\xe2\x80\x9d says Annette Mattlock, information technology director at TriStar Horizon Medical Center :hospital: in Dickson, Tenn. \xe2\x80\x9cAt the onset, our mission became more real to me than ever before, \xe2\x80\x98Above all else, we are committed to the care and improvement of human life\xe2\x80\x99. In my mind, this meant all life, our physicians, nurses, colleagues, patients and families.\xe2\x80\x9d 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cOur team of clinical and technical professionals support a variety of critical solutions, including telemedicine for physicians, electronic visits for patients and families, and capabilities for more colleagues to work from home. While ITG rarely provides direct patient care, it is our mission to care for those who do."
.
Thank you, Annette, and all ITG colleagues for #CaringDuringCOVID19. 
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #HCATechnology #Connect #PatientCare #Computers #Tennessee #HIT'

b"From complex injuries to large scale trauma, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s burn and wound care specialists collaborate to bring state-of-the-art, compassionate care to our patients and their families. This month, we\xe2\x80\x99re celebrating the one-year-anniversary of the JMS Burn Clinic at @capitalregionalmc with Harper Wilke\xe2\x80\x99s story. 
.
On a very scary day for her family, three-year-old Harper was accidentally burned on the exhaust pipe of her father\xe2\x80\x99s motorcycle as she ran to greet him and give him a hug. After evaluation by the JMS Burn Clinic team, it was determined that Harper would need to have surgery so that the burn could be debrided and cadaver skin applied to help it heal. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cLittle Harper was blessed with parents who were willing to do the best for her,\xe2\x80\x9d said HCA Healthcare nurse Chad Camp. \xe2\x80\x9cThey encouraged her when she was scared and reinforced our assurance by showing trust in the doctors and nurses. This, in turn, made our jobs a pleasure. For such a horrible incident, the circumstances and environment to fix and heal couldn't have been better.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Within four weeks, Harper\xe2\x80\x99s burn had healed. 
.
Harper\xe2\x80\x99s mother, Angelina says, \xe2\x80\x9cWe had amazing care and they comforted us. They educated us and told us exactly what we needed to do. We are so grateful to the team at the JMS Burn Clinic at Capital Regional Medical Center.\xe2\x80\x9d 
.
The new Tallahassee, Fla.-based burn center saw 1,400 clinic visit in its first year and is affiliated with the Joseph M. Still Burn Center at Doctors Hospital of Augusta in Ga. The Augusta burn center is the cornerstone of the Burn and Reconstructive Centers of America network, which encompasses more than 20% of the nation\xe2\x80\x99s burn admissions at 14 locations in eight states. 
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #HealthierTomorrows #BurnCare #BurnCenter #Georgia #JMSBurnCenter #Trauma #Florida"

b'In light of #NICUAwarenessMonth, we\xe2\x80\x99re honoring the families who have experienced stays in HCA Healthcare neonatal intensive care units (NICUs) and the healthcare heroes who care for them. 
.
HCA Healthcare NICU teams go above and beyond to inspire hope for NICU families and provide best-in-class care to our tiniest patients, like Larkin. She was brought to Medical City Children's Hospital in Dallas, Texas and was the first patient placed in their recently expanded NICU \xe2\x80\x93 the largest Level IV Neonatal ICU in North Texas. Larkin's mom expressed her sincere gratitude for the compassionate care her daughter has received. Born at 24 weeks, 1.2 lbs., Larkin is now 44 weeks, eight pounds and doing well! 
.
"COVID-19 has definitely posed some challenges in regards to making sure we continue to provide the highest quality care, while addressing the individual needs of our patients and their families,\xe2\x80\x9d said Amanda Atkins, nurse leader at Medical City Dallas. \xe2\x80\x9cWe've had to really focus on family-centered care. In these unusual times, the parents' emotional needs are equally as important as the medical needs of our patients. We collaborate as a team every shift to meet these needs \xe2\x80\x93 and to care like family."
.
Thank you to NICU colleagues \xe2\x80\x93 like Amanda \xe2\x80\x93 for your endless determination, incredible strength and inspiring tiny miracles each and every day. 
.
.
.
#HCABabies #NeonatalNursesWeek #CareLikeFamily #HealthierTomorrows #NICU #NICUNurse #NICUBaby #Dallas #Texas'

b"HCA Healthcare nurse technician, Audrey Valdez, will forever be a part of a League City, Texas family\xe2\x80\x99s birth story. Anticipating the birth of their fifth child, Joseph and Lauren Holloway headed to @hcahoustonhealthcare Clear Lake :hospital: after Lauren started experiencing contractions on Friday morning. But, to their surprise, their new family member arrived before they could make inside the hospital. Luckily\xe2\x80\xa6help wasn\xe2\x80\x99t too far away.
.
Audrey was assisting as a #COVID19 screener for individuals entering the hospital when she heard Joseph yell \xe2\x80\x9cshe's in labor!\xe2\x80\x9d from the nearby hospital parking lot. Audrey immediately sprang into action. She confirmed Lauren was in active labor, stayed calm and realized the baby was not going to wait. With steadfast care, she helped the family deliver their new bundle of joy in the parking lot. \xe2\x80\x9cI guess you can say this was the best scenario for me to be at the right place and the right time,\xe2\x80\x9d said Audrey. \xe2\x80\x9cIt makes me happy that I do what I do.\xe2\x80\x9d 
.
A baby boy named Ty Joseph was delivered at a healthy 6 lbs. 13 ounces. Less than 10 minutes after leaving home, he was safe in his mom\xe2\x80\x99s arms thanks to Audrey and our caregivers at HCA Houston Healthcare Clear Lake. 
.
#WATCH the full story at the :link: in bio!
.
.

#CareLikeFamily #HCABabies #NurseTech #Baby #Texas #Delivery #BirthStory #Hospital"

b'Germs are everywhere and can make us sick! They can easily attach to our hands and items we touch during normal, daily activities. The @cdcgov recommends washing hands with soap and water whenever possible because handwashing reduces the amount of germs and chemicals that can be spread to others. 
.
If soap and water are not available, using a hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol can help you avoid getting sick and spreading germs to others.
.
.
.
#SpreadKnowledge #SaveLives'

b'#ThankfulThursday Spreading cheer comes naturally to longtime hospital volunteer Ruth Batts. Knowing it can be a lonely time for patients in the hospital \xe2\x80\x93 especially during the #COVID19 pandemic \xe2\x80\x93  HCA Healthcare affiliate Fawcett Memorial Hospital :hospital: in Port Charlotte, Fla., initiated the Sunshine Calls program with Ruth\xe2\x80\x99s help. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cI have been a patient a few times at Fawcett Memorial Hospital and I know the days can be long,\xe2\x80\x9d says Ruth. \xe2\x80\x9cWhen I make the calls and connect with a patient, I hear the gratitude in their voice that they are being cared for.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
The Sunshine Calls program :telephone_selector: assigns hospital volunteers, who are home and still not able to return to the hospital, with a daily list of patients who agree to receive sunshine calls \xe2\x80\x93  a friendly check-in to see how the patient is doing, ask if they need anything and provide an ear just to listen. Some patients chat about their families, upbringing, time in the military, how they\xe2\x80\x99re feeling and more. 
.
 \xe2\x80\x9cWe understand that nothing can replace the feeling of a family member or friend visiting a patient in the hospital,\xe2\x80\x9d says Brandy Hershberger, chief nursing officer at Fawcett Memorial Hospital. \xe2\x80\x9cOur hope is that the sunshine calls can help brighten their day and help in the recovery process during this restrictive time.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Thank you Ruth, and all volunteers across our 186 hospitals, for always spreading cheer. 
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #PositiveImpact #Volunteer #Hope #Hospital #Cheer'

b'This #SuicidePrevention Awareness Month, several HCA Healthcare facilities have joined together to present a series of educational webinars to bring awareness to a myriad of suicide-related topics. This conversation comes at a pivotal time, with the @cdcgov recently detailing preliminary data on the massive mental health impact of #COVID19.
.
In a June CDC survey, 10.7% of respondents reported serious consideration of suicide in the past 30 days. Even further, for the youngest survey respondents aged 18-24, the CDC saw an alarming uptick in suicidal ideation, with 25% reporting that they\xe2\x80\x99d thought about ending their lives.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s critically important that HCA Healthcare works together to promote awareness of suicide and decreases the stigma that undoubtedly surrounds the topic. We must provide training for those that wish to help and give those struggling the support they need,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dr. Frank Drummond, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s medical director of behavioral health services.
.
We can all benefit from conversations around suicide prevention and awareness. Join the life-saving webinar discussion at the :link: in bio.
.
.
. 
#MentalHealth #StigmaFree #BeThe1To #Depression #BehavioralHealth'

b'Earlier this year, Elary Martinez received news that no one wants to hear \xe2\x80\x94 he had a tumor in his lungs. It was cancer. 

A celebrity in the foster kitten community, Elary of @myfosterkittens, was used to taking care of kittens in need. With his cancer diagnosis, it was his turn to be taken care of. 

After initially being told his surgery was going to be challenging, he was determined to find a physician who would treat him. That\xe2\x80\x99s where Dr. Jennifer Marks, a thoracic surgeon with HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s @medctrofaurora, came in. She established a plan of care for Elary and he traveled to Colorado for his life-saving surgery. And recently, after Elary was successfully discharged from the hospital, he took to Instagram and said, \xe2\x80\x9cThey got ALL of the cancer out! What a HAPPY DAY!\xe2\x80\x9d

Elary and his wife, Nikki, thanked our caregivers for \xe2\x80\x9ctheir kindness, care and compassion.\xe2\x80\x9d We are proud of our colleagues who continue to care like family in times like these, bringing an unmatched commitment to high-quality, safe, compassionate care. 

Please join us in sending Elary and his family well wishes during his recovery! 

#HealthierTomorrows #CareLikeFamily #CancerCare #ThoracicSurgeon #FosterKittens'

b'Our mission has never been more meaningful than it is today, as we battle the #COVID19 pandemic amid hurricanes, wildfires and tornadoes.

b'From #COVID19 to hurricane season, we\xe2\x80\x99ve stood and continue to stand prepared to aid our patients, colleagues and communities in 2020. The hospital saw tropical storm force winds of more than 80 mph. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cDealing with the unexpected is an everyday occurrence in healthcare \xe2\x80\x93 but a pandemic, hurricane and power outage bring \xe2\x80\x98unexpected\xe2\x80\x99 issues to a whole new level,\xe2\x80\x9d said Karen Hathorn, administrator at Rapides Women\xe2\x80\x99s and Children\xe2\x80\x99s Hospital. .
\xe2\x80\x9cWe have an amazing team at Rapides Women\xe2\x80\x99s and Children\xe2\x80\x99s Hospital and they all deserve kudos for a job well done. And to our sister facility at Rapides Regional Medical Center, we owe much gratitude for their help and hospitality,\xe2\x80\x9d Karen continues. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat a blessing it is to be a part of this team!\xe2\x80\x9d

.

b'For twin sisters Suzana Oquendo and Wendy Merlos, #CareLikeFamily takes on a whole new meaning. Both work at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s @capitalregionalmc in Florida \xe2\x80\x93 Suzana as a nurse and Wendy as a physical therapist. While working in healthcare during the pandemic has brought unforeseen challenges, they say having the support of one another has been crucial to navigating #COVID19 professionally and personally.
.
SUZANA: \xe2\x80\x9cAs twins we have always done many things together, never thought we would also be fighting this pandemic together as well. Working with COVID-19 patients as a charge nurse on the COVID-19 unit has been a mixture of emotions - from worried to sad to humbled and hopeful. I am so proud of the team of nurses that I have the opportunity to work with as they have done a tremendous job, regardless of the struggles the pandemic has brought to us. They are true COVID warriors!\xe2\x80\x9d
.
WENDY: \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s reassuring working alongside my twin sister during this time. I have been able to see this pandemic from several perspectives: my sister working on the COVID-19 unit, working in this environment myself, having family members with COVID -19, and unfortunately, losing my father-in-law to it. It has made me more aware of the emotional and physical difficulties that our COVID patients and their families go through during this difficult time. It has been a humbling experience to say the least.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Thank you to Suzana, Wendy and all of the front line caregivers who continue to provide compassionate care to those who need it most. 
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HealthcareHeroes #Twins #Nurse #PhysicalTherapy #Care #Florida'

b":party_popper: \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so happy!\xe2\x80\x9d Those were the words Julie White kept repeating as she was being discharged from @tristarcentennial after spending more than 45 days in the intensive care unit (ICU) fighting #COVID19. Our caregivers made her hospital exit extra special with confetti and a tiara!
.
While hospitalized in Nashville, Tenn., Julie spent several weeks on Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation (ECMO) \xe2\x80\x93  which provides life support for coronavirus patients suffering respiratory failure. \xe2\x80\x9cAs COVID ICU nurses, we realize that we are the only human contact that our patients experience so we embrace them as family,\xe2\x80\x9d says Tanisha Wilson, a HCA Healthcare nurse for 17 years. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cDuring the many days that I cared for Julie, I tried to make sure that she felt our caring and support,\xe2\x80\x9d Tanisha continues. \xe2\x80\x9cThere were many days where she was our sickest patient\xe2\x80\xa6so we FOUGHT. Watching her leave for rehab was one of our proudest moments\xe2\x80\xa6wins like Julie's are what sustain us.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Please join us in wishing Julie a continued recovery \xe2\x80\x93 we\xe2\x80\x99re celebrating with you every step of the way!
.
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #ImproveMoreLives #CaringDuringCOVID19"

b'On this #NationalDogDay, we\xe2\x80\x99re applauding the beloved facility, service and therapy dogs across HCA Healthcare who\xe2\x80\x99ve extended their reach in creative ways to provide comfort throughout #COVID19. :dog_face: :paw_prints:

.
A.J.\xe2\x80\x99s positive impact on the healing process comes at a critical time for many of our patients and colleagues. The latest data from the @cdcgov shows 40% of Americans surveyed reported struggling with mental health issues or substance abuse related to COVID-19. \xe2\x80\x9cWith the impact of COVID-19, we have seen an increase in patients,\xe2\x80\x9d said HealthONE occupational therapist Emma Kowal.

b"In 2019, HCA Healthcare saw more than 60,000 pediatric inpatient admissions and over 1.5 million children in the :hospital: emergency room. .

.

b'Last year, HCA Healthcare saw 9.2 million emergency room visits. :convenience_store: Much about life has changed since #COVID19 made landfall in the U.S., but some things have not: you should continue to seek care for medical emergencies such as heart attack or stroke. Emergency departments are equipped, prepared and available to take care of you and your family. Serving on the front lines of ER encounters are our fearless emergency department teams \xe2\x80\x93 who are steadfast and resolute in their commitment to keeping COVID-19 and non-COVID-19 patients safe. 
.
Healthcare hero Lindsay Cuff, emergency department director at Blake Medical Center in Bradenton, Fl., says working during the pandemic has been \xe2\x80\x9chumbling\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9ceye opening\xe2\x80\x9d. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cThe teamwork within my department is overwhelming. Branching out of my department and seeing the overall teamwork throughout the hospital and HCA Healthcare leaves me in awe. The endless resources we have been sent whenever asked for, reminds me that we all have to keep going because our patients need us now more than ever,\xe2\x80\x9d Lindsay continues. \xe2\x80\x9cI know at any time, it could be my family who needs COVID-19 treatment and I would hope to have such caring people treating us as I have seen my team do over the past couple months. I always tell myself, \xe2\x80\x98this too shall pass\xe2\x80\x99, and it will.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Thank you to Lindsay \xe2\x80\x93 and to all of our emergency services teams \xe2\x80\x93 for #CaringDuringCOVID19. 
.
.
.
#HCAHealthcareHeroes #CareLikeFamily'

b'#DYK: According to the @cdcgov, 26% (1 in 4) of all adults in the United States have some type of disability? This past month, HCA Healthcare celebrated the 30th Anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) by recognizing the many colleagues who\xe2\x80\x99ve taken decisive action to ensure equitable access to healthcare services for our patients and their companions with disabilities.
.
One of these colleagues is Dean Beasley. Dean assisted his patient, Emmanuel Martinez, in a profound way and even helped him realize his dream to become an artist after a traumatic burn injury that required amputations of both of his legs, his dominant right arm and part of his left hand. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cJust over twenty years ago, a young man came into my life who ended up ministering to me and my staff as much (or more) than we ended up providing care for him,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dean, ethics and compliance officer for Doctors Hospital of Augusta in Augusta, Ga. \xe2\x80\x9cNothing we did for him was found in any textbook, he was one of a kind. Due to advances led, in part by the provisions of the Americans with Disabilities Act, we were able to fit him with specialized equipment, unique prosthetics and the best medical care that the entire hospital could provide.\xe2\x80\x9d 
.
:right_arrow_selector: Learn more about the ADA and read Emmanuel\xe2\x80\x99s full story at the :link: in bio. :framed_picture: 
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #HealthierTomorrows #ADA'

b'Grace Leimann and Carlos Muniz were planning on getting married mid-July when their wedding plans got put on hold. After contracting #COVID19, the groom-to-be was admitted to @methodisthealthcaresa in San Antonio, Texas on July 15. A few days later, his health took a turn for the worse, and he was placed on an ECMO machine in the intensive care unit (ICU). Although Carlos has since tested negative for COVID-19, his body is still working to fully recover, and he is unable to come off of ECMO treatment. 
.
After learning about his patient\xe2\x80\x99s cancelled wedding plans, HCA Healthcare nurse Matt Holdridge knew that he needed to lift Carlos\xe2\x80\x99 spirits and encourage him to keep fighting. He suggested a bedside wedding. Once Carlos learned his wedding plans were being revived, his condition began to as well. 
.
The Muniz wedding not only brought joy and motivation to Carlos and his family, but it also presented a major victory to the COVID-19 unit at Methodist Hospital. "This wedding is really important for us as the care team of this patient,\xe2\x80\x9d Matt explained. "It was very special for us to be a part of and has been a big motivator for this team. It shows COVID-19 really can\xe2\x80\x99t stop love." 
.
#WATCH the special ceremony on @cnn at the :link: in bio. 
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #Wedding #Hospital #Care'

b'For many of our HCA Healthcare colleagues, COVID-19 has dramatically redefined their hospital roles. Many colleagues now screen patients and visitors at the door. b"\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s become a member of our front line care team rather quickly and has been instrumental in helping them,\xe2\x80\x9d says Dr. Stefanie Beaver, surgical and procedural services director at Medical City Dallas' Heart & Spine Hospitals.

Rolling down the hallways of Medical City Dallas Hospital\xe2\x80\x99s specialty Heart & Spine Hospitals in Dallas, Texas is a friendly, one-armed, bright-eyed robot. Nicknamed Moxi and regarded as one of the colleagues, she helps optimize nurses\xe2\x80\x99 daily tasks. Equipped with sensors to help her navigate, and even anticipate people\xe2\x80\x99s movements, she travels across hospital floors to assist with replenishing supplies, running samples to the lab and more. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cWhen we were opening up the hospital back in October, one of the things we wanted to really focus on was being an innovation center and bringing new technology to the healthcare setting,\xe2\x80\x9d said Josh Kemph, chief operating officer of the Medical City Heart Hospital and Medical City Spine Hospital. 
.
