b'Nurses have always been on the front lines \xe2\x80\x93 fighting diseases, comforting those that are scared, helping people who are hurting. And during the #COVID19 pandemic, they are the heroes we all need right now. Some nurses have traveled across the country to help. Others have fearlessly deployed to other departments that they\xe2\x80\x99ve never worked in before. Around the world, nurses have assumed new routines and safety protocols to face the crisis head-on. 
.
Meet HCA Healthcare nurse Angela Baker. \xe2\x80\x9cDuring COVID-19 nursing has become a more challenging career, but I\xe2\x80\x99m proud to be able to use my skills and knowledge to help my community,\xe2\x80\x9d says Angela, who serves our patients in the emergency department at Doctors Hospital of Sarasota :hospital: in Fla. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cHCA Healthcare has gone above and beyond to support staff with providing appropriate PPE, and sharing helpful updates about the spread of COVID-19 in our community,\xe2\x80\x9d Angela continues. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m comforted in knowing that I can be proactive in protecting myself and my loved ones by continuing to wear masks, social distance and practice good hand hygiene.\xe2\x80\x9d 
.
Thank you to Angela, and to our entire HCA Healthcare family, for #CaringDuringCOVID19.

b'Wearing a shirt that read "I survived coronavirus 2020," HCA Healthcare patient Matt Elizardo, mustered up the courage to walk himself to the car to restart his life after a 113 day stay at @henricodoctorshospital in Richmond, Va. Amid cheers and tears from his doctors and nurses, his wife stood ready to bring her husband home after nearly four months of FaceTime interactions.
.
On April 8, Matt, who is a frontline grocery store worker, was admitted to the hospital for #COVID19. The next day, he was intubated. And, a few days later, he suffered from sudden cardiac arrest. Even still, Matt\xe2\x80\x99s resilience, combined with the efforts of his care team, helped him to defy the odds and beat the virus.
.
Unable to walk, talk or eat on his own, Matt began intensive rehabilitation treatment on June 3, 2020. "Matt faced a lot of adversity during his battle with the virus and was in acute condition while on a ventilator for many weeks. It truly is amazing to see him walk out of these doors and hug everyone goodbye. It's incredible," said Kristen Klimkowski, a speech therapist at Parham Doctors' Hospital who was an instrumental part of Matt's recovery and care team.
.
Welcome home, Matt!
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HealthierTomorrows'

b'Today, we remember. We remember the grief, the first responders, the healers, the recoveries and the resilience of the El Paso, Texas community. One year ago, 23 lives were lost and a city was forever changed during a horrific attack that occurred at an El Paso Walmart shopping center. Shortly after the first shots were fired, it was clear that HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s Del Sol Medical Center, located only three miles from the shopping center, would be receiving victims. Colleagues raced to the hospital to save lives and offer support.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cWhen we say \xe2\x80\x98Above all else we are committed to the care and improvement of human life,\xe2\x80\x99 it\xe2\x80\x99s never been more evident to me that that\xe2\x80\x99s exactly what our response to the event of August 3rd ended up being.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 David Shimp, chief executive officer at Del Sol Medical Center
.
At the :link: in bio, find out how HCA Healthcare family members stood ready to respond and heal through trauma care and other extraordinary acts of service.
.
.
.
#ElPasoStrong  #CareLikeFamily #HCATrauma #ElPaso'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s the little things in life that sometimes mean the most. For one patient battling #COVID19, it was an act of kindness from an HCA Healthcare nurse that made her hospital stay a little brighter. 
.
Wanda Cleveland, a grandmother of six, was unable to attend a birthday party for one of her grandchildren while hospitalized at @tridentmedicalcenter in Charleston, S.C. Her nurse, Allie Fant, did not want Wanda to miss out on the occasion. She helped connect Wanda to the birthday party via a video conference call. During the virtual encounter, Wanda was able to sing "Happy Birthday" to her 16-year-old granddaughter.
.
Thank you to Allie \xe2\x80\x93 and to our Information Technology Group (ITG) colleagues \xe2\x80\x93 for your innovation and compassion during a time of isolation for many patients. Whether it be a simple check-in or closure before a loved one passes, virtual visits aid in the healing process.
.
.
.

b'More than 28,000 of our quarter-million-plus HCA Healthcare colleagues are veterans, reservists or active duty personnel. One of them is Maria Spingos, director of nursing for behavioral health at @westfloridahospital :hospital: in Pensacola, Fla. She not only serves HCA Healthcare patients, but also her country :United_States: in times of need as a U.S. Navy reservist. A credentialed psychiatric nurse with the @usnavyreserve, Maria says her Navy experience has helped prepare her for work in a civilian setting.
.
In early April, duty called. Like many other military personnel, she was asked to mobilize to New York to help treat #COVID19 patients. Maria used her nursing skills and expertise to support a team at the @javitscenter in Manhattan, taking care of the sickest of patients as a member of the prone team. \xe2\x80\x9cOn a regular schedule, we turn patients in their beds to the prone position [chest down] to help improve lung function,\xe2\x80\x9d she says. \xe2\x80\x9cThis allows the nurses to continue care without interruption of position.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
We are thankful to have a roster full of veterans like Maria. We appreciate your courage and commitment to #CaringDuringCOVID19.
.
:right_arrow_selector: Read Maria\xe2\x80\x99s full story at the :link: in bio.
.
.
.
#HCAHealthcareHeroes #HealthierTomorrows #Navy #Reservist #HealthcareHeroes #Service'

b"Last year, Lowell Bauers was in end-stage renal failure, and the only hope of prolonging his life was a kidney transplant. His daughter, HCA Healthcare nurse Lindsey Bauers, was tested to see if she was a good candidate to donate one of her kidneys. She was a perfect match. 
.
Lindsey, who takes care of patients at @missionhealthnc in Asheville, N.C., wanted to proceed with the transplant surgery, but as a full-time nurse and the mother of a small child, she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t sure how she\xe2\x80\x99d be able to afford the time off work and childcare she\xe2\x80\x99d need during the eight-week recovery period following the transplant. 
.
That\xe2\x80\x99s where the HCA Healthcare Hope Fund stepped in. In tough times, we support our HCA Healthcare family through the Hope Fund. To date, we've helped over 37,000 HCA Healthcare families experiencing hardships that range from illness and death of a loved one to domestic violence and recovery from natural disasters. More recently, the Hope Fund has even provided funds for childcare to employees whose children are home from school due to the #COVID19 pandemic.
.
:right_arrow_selector: Read Lindsey\xe2\x80\x99s full story at the :link: in bio. 
.
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #HCACares #GiftOfLife #Nurse #Transplant #KidneyTransplant #Hope"

b'As the pandemic continues, #Gratitude for healthcare personnel around the world is one thing we all have in common. As we see these heroes adapt and lean on each other when new challenges arise, let us be inspired to help them succeed by doing our part.

.
\xe2\x80\x9cThis experience has changed me in many ways and strengthened my faith. This has been one of the most challenging environments I have ever faced, but my fellow nurses and I have learned how to band together and uplift each other,\xe2\x80\x9d Madeline continues. \xe2\x80\x9cWhen you can make a difference in patients\xe2\x80\x99 lives and each other\xe2\x80\x99s lives, it\xe2\x80\x99s really a beautiful thing. That is why we are here and why we continue to do what we do."

b'Hospitalized for 11 days at @kendallregionalmedicalcenter, HCA Healthcare patient and @miamidadefirerescue firefighter Raul Perez said his caregivers went above and beyond to help him put out a fire he never saw coming. After testing positive for #COVID19, Raul began to feel the physical and mental gravity of the virus. One day during his hospital stay, he looked out the window of his fourth-floor room to see a firetruck :fire_engine: and some of his coworkers from the department.
.
His extended fire family had shown up to make sure Raul knew he wasn\xe2\x80\x99t fighting COVID-19 alone. They rose the ladder and, one by one, came up to his hospital window to see the 25-year veteran firefighter. \xe2\x80\x9cTo see them literally do that and for them to climb all the way to the top of that ladder just to see me, it\xe2\x80\x99s hard to explain but it was the most heartwarming experience of my life,\xe2\x80\x9d Raul said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was wonderful. It was amazing.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Raul equally sends gratitude to his care team at Kendall Regional Medical Center. "They\xe2\x80\x99re miracle workers. All the nurses, all the doctors did a great job there. The medications I was on helped tremendously and I owe them my life,\xe2\x80\x9d he says. 
.
Thank you to our #HealthcareHeroes for helping this hero :man_firefighter: heal, recover and move forward.
.
:right_arrow_selector: #WATCH Raul\xe2\x80\x99s story at the :link: in bio!
.
.
. 
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #HealthierTomorrows'

b'Meet healthcare hero Adam Schloemer, an executive chef at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s @medicalcitylascolinas in Irving, Texas. During the pandemic, his team has adapted to their new environment with resilience and determination to provide comfort in the form of a warm meal. 
.
From behind-the-scenes duties like reviewing recipes and ordering produce to creating individualized dishes to meet inpatients\xe2\x80\x99 unique nutrition needs, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s food and nutrition services teams work hard to keep colleagues, patients and visitors fed and healthy. During #COVID19, many have gone above and beyond the call of duty, setting up pop-up grocery stores in their hospitals for front line caregivers to easily take home food to their families. By getting creative, they were able to offer colleagues affordable pre-packaged food bundles and staples such as milk, eggs, fruits, vegetables and paper products. 
.
Thank you to Adam \xe2\x80\x93 and to all of our food and nutrition services teams \xe2\x80\x93 for #CaringDuringCOVID19! 
.
.

b"After an 89-day stay at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s Largo Medical Center in Largo, Fla., 35-year-old Michael Griffin won a hard fought battle with #COVID19 and was discharged home. Our colleagues were overjoyed to send him off with well-wishes for a continued road to recovery.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cI was lucky enough to care for Michael during the middle of his critical COVID fight, and what a fighter he is!\xe2\x80\x9d said Dayle Rippee, a HCA Healthcare nurse at Largo Medical Center. \xe2\x80\x9cBetween coding him multiple times and thinking at various moments that each breath could be his last, to being his nurse on the day that his first negative test came back and he began to make a turn around, I could not be more proud of the progress he has made throughout his journey here at LMC.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
In the midst of his battle with COVID-19, Michael asked Dayle if he would ever walk again. She assured him that while it might be a long road, if he worked hard and had faith, she believed he would walk again.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cI'll never forget the first time he stood up with PT, I was cheering him on from the nurse\xe2\x80\x99s station and truthfully had tears of joy in my eyes at the sight. He might have only stood for a few seconds, but he was determined,\xe2\x80\x9d Dayle continued. \xe2\x80\x9cHis sheer will and commitment to his recovery is what helped him walk out of the hospital today, and I am beyond proud to say that I had a small part in his victory. It is patients and moments like this that reinforce our mission...Above all else, we are committed to the care and improvement of human life.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Before Michael left his care team, he had one final request from them. A celebratory sip of his favorite drink, @drpepper. Cheers, Michael! We\xe2\x80\x99re rooting for you every step of the way as you continue healing.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily"

b':orange_heart::baby::blue_heart: What a joy it is to see HCA Healthcare patient Jessica Rowlett finally cradle her newborn son in her arms. Jessica, who tested positive for #COVID19 in May, delivered her second child via an emergency C-section that took place while she was on a ventilator. Baby Rowdy was born at @tristarcentennial in Nashville, Tenn. at 33 weeks, weighing 4 pounds, 15 ounces. He spent the first few weeks of his life in the hospital\xe2\x80\x99s NICU, while a multi-disciplinary team worked hard to restore Jessica\xe2\x80\x99s health.
.
After delivery, Jessica was placed on an ECMO machine for nearly two weeks. She credits the machine \xe2\x80\x93 which pumps and oxygenates a patient's blood outside the body \xe2\x80\x93 with saving her life. \xe2\x80\x9cWithout the ECMO I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be here," Jessica said.
.
Jessica slowly and miraculously began to regain her strength. "It was pretty incredible to see all that she went through and how strong she was and how poised she was through the entire process," intensive care unit nurse, Mary Shea, told @goodmorningamerica. Eventually, Jessica was discharged from the hospital on June 26, the same day as her son.
.
:right_arrow_selector: Read Jessica\xe2\x80\x99s full story on Good Morning America at the :link: in bio.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HealthierTomorrows #HCABabies #Recovery #NICU #COVIDSurvivor'

b'As we continue to navigate #COVID19, the demand for testing is climbing. The teamwork displayed by HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s lab teams has been endless as they work together behind-the-scenes to keep our communities safe and our clinicians informed.
.
Our Integrated Regional Laboratories (IRL) team \xe2\x80\x93 based out of Fort Lauderdale, Fla. \xe2\x80\x93 is helping their community in the fight against COVID-19. These dedicated laboratory colleagues test for the novel coronavirus, ensuring that patients receive the correct diagnosis and treatment. Over the past several months, the IRL team has worked tirelessly to process more than 30,000 COVID-19 test results. We send our deepest gratitude to these often unseen medical heroes.
.
Thank you to all of the laboratory professionals across HCA Healthcare \xe2\x80\x93 you are an integral part of the care team and we applaud you today and every day!
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #Gratitude #HealthcareHeroes #Lab #Results  #COVIDTesting'

b'#ICYMI HCA Healthcare was honored as a recipient of the John M. Eisenberg Patient Safety and Quality Award in a virtual event last week put on by The Joint Commission and the National Quality Forum for our pioneering work using artificial intelligence to help reduce sepsis mortality.
.
Our innovative SPOT technology, which earned the prestigious award, uses predictive analytics to help clinicians \xe2\x80\x9cspot\xe2\x80\x9d potentially deadly sepsis infections.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re using the big data of scale to learn at speed, empowering our clinicians and other decision makers through AI-based technology to provide more reliable, more efficient and more compassionate healthcare,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dr. Jonathan Perlin, president of clinical operations and chief medical officer at HCA Healthcare.
.
During the virtual award ceremony, Dr. Perlin said \xe2\x80\x9cThe Eisenberg Award demonstrates our commitment to the mission of HCA Healthcare that \xe2\x80\x98Above all else, we are committed to the care and improvement of human life\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\xa6 it\xe2\x80\x99s an extraordinary privilege to receive this year\xe2\x80\x99s national innovation award. Thank you very much.\xe2\x80\x9d 
.
Click the :link: in bio to learn more about our commitment to patient safety and healthcare quality.
.
.
.
#EisenbergAwards #SPOT #ImproveMoreLives #Sepsis #PatientSafety'

b'Earlier this week, 24-year-old #COVID19 patient, Paola Castillo, was greeted by her caregivers at Medical City North Hills as they cheered her on during her discharge from the hospital. With each clap and tear shed, colleagues celebrate her fighting spirit and remarkable recovery after a 79-day stay at the hospital, which included a month in the intensive care unit and on the ventilator.
.
After slowly being weaned from the ventilator, Paola worked with nurses, therapists and other colleagues to relearn how to talk, swallow and walk. Nurses, therapists and other staff worked to provide compassionate care and meaningful connections to keep her motivated and positive during rehabilitation. Caregivers even helped Paola venture outside to feel the rain after 67 days inside the hospital. She took her first steps since being admitted on July 3.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cWhat we are doing right now is at the heart of what it is to be human. What the care team has done for even this one patient is a mark of a life well lived and a purpose served,\xe2\x80\x9d says Andrea Morian, director of Rehabilitation Services at Medical City North Hills.
.
Click the :link: in bio to read more about Paola\xe2\x80\x99s story on @cnn.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #ImproveMoreLives'

b'Today marks the 15th anniversary of the HCA Healthcare Hope Fund. In 2005, the Hope Fund was just ramping up operations when Hurricane Katrina hit New Orleans. Despite being in its early stages of operations, colleagues rallied together to provide more than $4 million in grants to fellow colleagues in need after the storm. Since then, more than 37,000 colleagues have received over $61 million in assistance for hardships like extended illness or injury, domestic violence, death, natural disasters and other special circumstances.
.
In the midst of a storm of a different kind \xe2\x80\x93 COVID-19 \xe2\x80\x93 we can think of no better way to observe this milestone than to remind our 280,000 colleagues that the Hope Fund continues to be here to provide assistance to colleagues in need.
.
Click the :link: in bio to meet a HCA Healthcare colleague whose family was helped by the Hope Fund 15 years ago + learn more about COVID-19-related Hope Fund assistance.
.
.
.
#HCACares #CaringDuringCOVID19 #Hope'

b'Awareness. Preparation. Response. At the onset of COVID-19, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s Enterprise Emergency Operations Center (EEOC) mobilized to ensure that leaders across our health system had the resources needed for their facilities to provide uninterrupted patient care. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cBefore we identified our first patient in San Jose, California, our EEOC was activated, and directives were given for all facilities to activate their facility EOCs,\xe2\x80\x9d said Mike Wargo, vice president of Enterprise Preparedness & Emergency Operations at HCA Healthcare. \xe2\x80\x9cReadiness for a potential COVID-19 surge across the U.S. was the organization\xe2\x80\x99s top priority.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
We continue to make sure the patients who depend on our hospitals receive needed and timely care while balancing our readiness to care for patients with COVID-19. Learn more at the :link: in bio.
.
.
.
#HCAEmergencyOperations #EmergencyPreparedness #CaringDuringCOVID19'

b'HCA Healthcare Heroes are brave. They are resilient. And they deliver on our mission to care for and improve human life both inside and outside of our hospital walls.

Ten months ago, one of the most powerful storms ever recorded battered the Bahamas. With peak winds at 185-mph, #HurricaneDorian damaged structures, took lives, erased entire neighbors and left survivors traumatized. Amid the chaos, a handful of HCA Healthcare Heroes from Memorial Hospital spread light in a dark moment by providing critical medical aid to those impacted.

\xe2\x80\x9cWe are all individually, and as an organization, really great about being involved and jumping into whatever we think is going to help the community,\xe2\x80\x9d said Allie Biess, HCA Healthcare ICU nurse. \xe2\x80\x9cIf you see someone hurting, and you can do anything, I just don\xe2\x80\x99t know why you wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t.\xe2\x80\x9d

Meet the courageous group of heroes who braved the storm here at the link in bio. 

#HCAHealthcareHeroes #HCAEmergencyOperations #Hurricane #Relief #Storm'

b'The novel coronavirus has required a novel response. Across our system, HCA Healthcare hospitals have used our collective know-how to fuel a number of innovations that benefit patients and caregivers.
.
As the unprecedented pandemic made landfall in the U.S., we developed practices to make care safer and more efficient for all patients. Since patients with preexisting conditions are at particularly high risk for infection, Medical City Plano in Texas launched a new program, allowing Coumadin and heart failure patients to be seen right in their car.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cThe team is waiting outside with kits for lab draws and any vitals,\xe2\x80\x9d says Tammy Bauer, assistant vice president of Cardiovascular Services at Medical City Healthcare in Dallas. \xe2\x80\x9cFor heart failure patients who need more than labs, after completing lab work, they\xe2\x80\x99re sent home and the rest of the visit is managed using telehealth technology.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Click the :link: in bio to learn about other COVID-19 innovations that have occurred the past few months.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #ImproveMoreLives #HCAHeart #DriveThrough #Care #Innovation'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cWhen I was little, I used to think that the white uniforms nurses used to wear made them look like angels. That\xe2\x80\x99s when I knew I wanted to be a nurse\xe2\x80\xa6 I knew I wanted to make a difference in people\xe2\x80\x99s lives,\xe2\x80\x9d said Lucy Sebastian, a HCA Healthcare cardiovascular (CV) intensive care unit (ICU) nurse.
.
Lucy has been a nurse at @westsideregional for 12 years. While she never thought the day would come that she would be faced with a pandemic, she knew it was a possibility, and she has met the challenge willingly.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cBeing a cardiovascular nurse always fascinated me. The high acuity of CV patients with ventricular assist devices, IABP and open heart surgeries is what really captivated me. When I chose to become a nurse, I was well aware of the possibility of a pandemic and the epidemics of infectious disease,\xe2\x80\x9d said Lucy. \xe2\x80\x9cMy job as a nurse is to take care of my patients, my colleagues and my community in their most vulnerable time. I do this by providing quality and safe care, while maintaining a safe environment for the entire healthcare team.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Thank you, Lucy, and all of our frontline colleagues who continue to rise up with resilience to meet the challenges brought on by this pandemic.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #HCANursing #Nurse #ICU'

.

b'HCA Healthcare patient Maggie Sillero\xe2\x80\x99s story has gone viral after she survived #COVID19 and gave birth to three healthy triplets at @thewomanshosptx. :baby::baby::baby:
.
Because her pregnancy was considered high risk, Maggie was admitted to the hospital at 28 weeks. She received a COVID-19 test, which is standard in the admission process. Maggie was positive.
.
During Maggie\xe2\x80\x99s hospital stay, Dr. Dolar S. Patolia balanced her health along with the babies\xe2\x80\x99 and says the brave mother was \xe2\x80\x9cincredibly strong\xe2\x80\x9d. In the antepartum unit, Maggie spent a lot of time FaceTiming with her family and bonding with her nurses. Donned in full PPE, they learned her routine, anticipated her needs and kept her company.
.
Thankful for the care she received, Maggie told @goodmorningamerica, \xe2\x80\x9cThe doctors and nurses were so compassionate. They kept telling me it was going to be OK."
.
The triplets, named Isabella, Nathaniel and Adriel, turned 1 month old on July 4 in the hospital\xe2\x80\x99s NICU. "Each of them have almost doubled their weight in this month, which is amazing. I\xe2\x80\x99m so proud of them, they are fighters," Maggie adds.
.
Read Maggie\xe2\x80\x99s story on Good Morning America by clicking the :link: in bio.
.
.
.
#HCABabies #HCAWomens #HealthierTomorrows #NICU #Triplets #Strong #Fighters'

b'HCA Healthcare patient Shakell Avery had much to celebrate this #FourthOfJuly \xe2\x80\x93 which also marked the Kansas City, Missouri resident\xe2\x80\x99s 24th birthday. He was recently discharged home after a 76-day stay at affiliate Menorah Medical Center in Overland Park, Kansas where he won a hard fought battle with coronavirus.
.
Grateful to be a #COVID19 survivor, Shakell and his family returned to the hospital to thank his care team. At the reunion, he proudly wore a t-shirt with the words \xe2\x80\x9cI Beat COVID 19\xe2\x80\x9d on it. Nurses emotionally waved signs that read \xe2\x80\x9cShakell Strong\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9cShakell, you\xe2\x80\x99re our hero.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
To save his life, Menorah Medical Center teamed up with HCA Healthcare sister facility @research_medical_center to transfuse the then critically-ill patient with convalescent plasma.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cWithout amazing care from the physicians, nurses and caregivers at Menorah Medical Center and the hard work and perseverance of the Research Medical Center collaborating physicians our beloved son, Shakell, would not be here today,\xe2\x80\x9d says Willetta Avery, Shakell\xe2\x80\x99s mother. \xe2\x80\x9cWe are filled with gratitude for their compassionate care during a very difficult and tenuous time.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Click the :link: in bio to learn more about Shakell\xe2\x80\x99s story and the heartfelt reunion with his care team.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #Recovery #Reunion #Survivor #ConvalescentPlasma'

b':red_heart_selector::baby::white_heart::baby::blue_heart::baby: Meet the strong firecracker who beat #COVID19 during her third trimester then delivered healthy triplets at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s @thewomanshosptx. Despite her circumstances, her attitude remained brighter than fireworks on the Fourth of July :sparkler:.
\xc2\xa0
On May 8, 2020, at 28 weeks pregnant, Maggie arrived to the hospital for her scheduled admission so she and her babies could be monitored in our antepartum unit. When she presented, she received a COVID19 test, which is standard in the admission process to safeguard patients and those who provide care. Forty-eight hours later, on Mother\xe2\x80\x99s Day, Maggie\xe2\x80\x99s care team arrived in her room in full PPE to report that her test results came back: she was positive.
\xc2\xa0
During her weeks in the antepartum unit, Maggie spent a lot of time FaceTiming with her family, including her husband who was also COVID-positive, and bonding with her nurses. Maggie shared that not only did her nurses learn her routine and anticipate her needs, but they would sit with her for an hour at a time, sweating under their PPE, just to keep her company.
\xc2\xa0
On June 4, after 5 COVID tests, with the final two negative, Maggie learned during her weekly ultrasound that \xe2\x80\x9cBaby A\xe2\x80\x99s\xe2\x80\x9d cord was wrapped around her neck, and she would have a C-section that day.
\xc2\xa0
\xe2\x80\xaaAt 4:51 p.m., \xe2\x80\x9cBaby A,\xe2\x80\x9d Isabella, was born at 3.11 lbs. At 4:53 p.m., \xe2\x80\x9cBaby B,\xe2\x80\x9d Nathaniel, was born at 3.7 lbs. Finally, at 4:55 p.m., \xe2\x80\x9cBaby C,\xe2\x80\x9d Adriel, was born at 2.1 lbs.\xc2\xa0 The doctors and nurses were amazed by how well Maggie did. She and her babies, who arrived in perfect ABC order, were healthy, safe and undeniably resilient.\xe2\x80\xac
\xc2\xa0
Reflecting on all she\xe2\x80\x99s been through, Maggie feels more confident than ever that everything happens for a reason. \xe2\x80\x9cAs a mom, you want control, but right now, you have to accept that you don\xe2\x80\x99t have control of everything. You have to let other people help you and remember you aren\xe2\x80\x99t alone. Look forward to each day and celebrate every small victory.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xc2\xa0
#HCABabies #HealthierTomorrows #Triplets'

b'What we\xe2\x80\x99re made of is incredible people. People like Stephanie Aguirre, a relief charge nurse that cares for HCA Healthcare patients in the intensive care unit (ICU) at @mercyhospitalmiami in Miami, Fla. 
.
Stephanie reflects on working the frontlines of #COVID19: \xe2\x80\x9cI always feel proud for trying my absolute best during times of uncertainty. Alongside my amazing team, I am able to take care of patients who are intubated, in septic shock and/or on multiple medications. After days of working hard, you get to see them recuperate and get transferred out of intensive care. I feel a huge sense of gratitude knowing that I have made a difference in someone\xe2\x80\x99s life. Through this experience I have learned no matter the roadblock that\xe2\x80\x99s put in front of me, I have the strength and perseverance to keep pushing forward. Giving up is never an option.\xe2\x80\x9d 
.
Thank you to Stephanie, and all our front line heroes, for your unwavering dedication to provide lifesaving care in times of need. You are true heroes. 
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HealthierTomorrows #CareLikeFamily'

b'Wife. Mother. Nurse. Air Force Reservist. Healthcare Hero.
.
Meet HCA Healthcare operating room nurse, Tamika Linen, who serves patients at Trident Medical Center :hospital: in Charleston, S.C. and most recently served our country as a reservist in the @usairforce. A member of the 315th Airlift Wing at Joint Base Charleston, Tamika is back in the operating room at Trident Medical Center this week after spending the last two months caring for #COVID19 patients in New York City\xe2\x80\x99s Queens Hospital. 
.
Of her stint in NYC, Tamika says, \xe2\x80\x9cI was there during the first phase of COVID-19 and it was very busy. The nurses and physicians were very thankful for our help. But, it\xe2\x80\x99s great to be back home with my family and back in the OR with my friends who supported me when I was away. I missed my husband and my son. My parents are here. They kept in touch with me on a regular basis but there\xe2\x80\x99s nothing like the touch of your family.\xe2\x80\x9d 
.
We\xe2\x80\x99re honored to have Tamika as part of the HCA Healthcare family. :United_States: Thank you for your service, courage and commitment to #CaringDuringCOVID19. 
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #PositiveImpact #Reservist'

b'Last year, hundreds of thousands of expectant mothers placed their trust in HCA Healthcare to deliver over 220,000 babies into the world. Hear from Katie, a post-surgical nurse at affiliate @thewomanshosptx who recently delivered her second baby boy, Benjamin, amid #COVID19.
.
KATIE: \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s going to be OK.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Katie had just entered her third trimester when the coronavirus pandemic struck Houston. Because there is still so much unknown about COVID-19, she spent the last months of her pregnancy feeling very scared, making it much different from her first. Katie explained one of her biggest fears was ensuring she and her husband, Jonathan, stayed healthy before it was time for her deliver \xe2\x80\x93 she knew once they were in the hospital, they would be protected. Jonathan shared that amid a global pandemic, the hospital truly felt like a safe space for them, and he couldn\xe2\x80\x99t have imagined a better place for Katie to deliver.
.
Reflecting on her own pregnancy journey, Katie wants those expecting to really focus on taking their time with everything and make caring for themselves a priority, as that will help their baby more than anything. As she cradled the healthy newborn she triumphantly delivered during a pandemic, Katie gave the following advice: \xe2\x80\x9cBreathe. It\xe2\x80\x99s so important.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
We feel privileged to have this strong, courageous mother as a HCA Healthcare nurse, and couldn\xe2\x80\x99t be happier for Katie and her beautiful family. Thank you to our colleagues who continue #CaringDuringCOVID19.
.
.
.
#HCAWomens #HCABabies #CareLikeFamily'

b'A new haircut :person_getting_haircut:coordinated by HCA Healthcare colleagues recently boosted the confidence of a very special patient.
.
Justin Blakely was admitted to affiliate @methodiststoneoakhospital for pancreatitis and gallstones in December 2019. After five months of persevering through various complications and surgeries, Justin has become a member of our HCA Healthcare family.
.
His care team wanted to give Justin a sense of normalcy, so they coordinated with a local hairstylist to surprise him with a fresh, new look. Justin was thrilled and said the haircut truly made him feel "new".
.
Thank you to these colleagues and all of our care teams who go above and beyond in delivering superior patient care.
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #HealthierTomorrows'

b'Today is #Juneteenth. The Emancipation Proclamation officially went into effect on January 1, 1863. But, #DYK it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t until June 19, 1865 when Union soldiers arrived in Galveston, Texas to announce the end of the Civil War that those enslaved in Texas learned of their freedom?
.
Juneteenth, observed annually by generations of Black families, is a day to reflect, rejoice, and educate. Whether you plan to celebrate with friends (socially distanced, of course) or participate in a virtual event, we encourage you to observe this milestone in American history. This day is an opportunity to have #BraveConversations about the current struggle for racial equality and justice in our country.
.
Acknowledging and celebrating Juneteenth is just one step in our journey toward a healthier, more equitable tomorrow.
.
.
.
#Juneteenth #Celebration #Reflection #Education #Conversation'

b'Our environmental services (EVS) teams are truly \xe2\x80\x9ckeepers of the house\xe2\x80\x9d, touching lives with great compassion. Bibi Ali, a HCA Healthcare EVS associate, plays a critical role in keeping patients and colleagues safe at @westsideregional.
.
Recently Bibi provided encouragement and offered an attentive ear to our patient, Shane Brown. Shane has Mast Cell Activation Syndrome, a condition which causes his lungs to swell shut and experience severe allergic reactions when exposed to strong smells, such as cleaning supplies and perfume.
.
When Bibi saw a sign on Shane\xe2\x80\x99s hospital room door that requested it not be cleaned, she inquired to see how she could help. After talking to Shane and his care team about his condition, she went out of her way to clean his entire room with safe, odorless supplies.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cI have a syndrome where one breath of perfume and my lungs will swell shut. I carry an EpiPen with me at all times. For her to stop, ask about the no cleaning sign and go out of her way to clean my room given the circumstances, is just phenomenal. I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t believe it,\xe2\x80\x9d said Shane. \xe2\x80\x9cMy room looked great. I asked her why she did it and she said she wanted to make sure I had a clean environment. It was the sweetest thing and something I will never forget. It meant a lot to me. Customer service in a hospital is just as important as how good the surgeon performing my surgery is and I don\xe2\x80\x99t take things like that for granted.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Thank you Bibi and ALL of our colleagues for creating #HealthierTomorrows for our patients.
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #PositiveImpact #Hospital #Compassion #EnvironmentalServices'

b'During the past few months, our colleagues have boldly kept their promise to improve more lives in more ways \xe2\x80\x93 starting with each other.

Lisa Ramirez, a biller for HCA Healthcare affiliate @parallon_business_solutions  based in San Antonio, has always felt \xe2\x80\x9ccompelled to help people in a time of need\xe2\x80\x9d. She contributed to the HCA Healthcare Hope Fund with every paycheck. 100% of all donations to this fund go directly to help HCA Healthcare colleagues and their families experiencing unavoidable financial hardships. Never in her wildest dreams did Lisa think that she would one day become a grant recipient herself. But, that\xe2\x80\x99s exactly what happened after a stroke left her husband unable to work.
.
#WATCH Lisa\xe2\x80\x99s story and find out how the HCA Healthcare Hope Fund supported her family, allowing her to cover her family\xe2\x80\x99s bills until her husband was well enough to return to work.
.

b'HCA Healthcare pediatric patient Edwin Fischer is a tiny boy with a big birth story. Born 12 weeks prematurely, he arrived at @rmhcfamily via @airlifedenver just as a \xe2\x80\x9cbomb cyclone\xe2\x80\x9d blizzard moved out of the area.

.

b'After Luis Etienne suffered heart failure, he was put on the organ donor list in April in hopes of finding a perfect match. His son, U.S. Army Major Luis Etienne Jr., did everything he could to come home to Texas to see his father at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s @methodisthealthcaresa.
.
Once he was granted emergency leave, Luis Jr. arrived in Texas. That same day his father was matched for a heart transplant. "It was a double surprise," commented Luis's wife, Alcira.
.
While he was visiting, Major Etienne requested his father pin him as he was promoted to Lieutenant Colonel. Caregivers helped put together a special ceremony for the family as Luis formally pinned his son into his new rank.
.
Thank you Major Luis for your service and to our colleagues for making this incredible moment happen.
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #HealthierTomorrows'

b'HCA Healthcare led the nation last year, performing more live donor kidney transplants than any other hospital system in the country. Living donation has transformed kidney transplantation, often sparing patients a long and uncertain wait on the transplant list.
.

While we work hard to provide superior patient-centered care throughout the exchange process, the donors are the real heroes.\xe2\x80\x9d
.

b"Throughout the past few months, there have been many moments that have lifted us up. Neighbors helping neighbors. Unforgettable acts of gratitude. And, of course, our medical heroes on the frontlines.

She recently found a simple solution to curb the physical discomfort as a result of wearing a mask \xe2\x80\x93 with a headband and buttons.
.
She's made over 500 headbands and not only shared them with her colleagues and other local facilities, but even to friends in need in New York City.

b'After Jason Ulloa recovered from #COVID19, he was motivated to help others who contracted the virus, so he decided to donate his plasma. Ulloa\xe2\x80\x99s convalescent plasma donation helped multiple critically ill HCA Healthcare patients with COVID-19, including Teresa Zavala. Zavala, treated at affiliate @medicalcitylascolinas, has now been discharged from the hospital.
.
"The generosity of people donating their plasma after recovering from a serious illness like COVID-19 is always astounding to me," said Dr. Steven Davis, the medical director of infection prevention at Medical City Las Colinas. "How generous that is for a person to take their own blood serum and to donate that at the plasma center in the hopes of making someone better. It warms my heart."
.
Medical City Las Colinas is one of 175 hospitals in our network that are using convalescent plasma to help treat COVID-19 patients as part of a national study. If you have recently recovered from COVID-19, consider donating your plasma to the study.
.
Click the :link: in bio for the full story.
.
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #ImproveMoreLives'

b"We hope this beautiful patient recovery brings a smile to those who need it today. Esther spent the last eight weeks at affiliate @methodisthealthcaresa after testing positive for #COVID19. When her care team recognized a decline in her health, they decided to create a video dancing to her favorite Korean boy band, @bts.bighitofficial, in hopes of getting their attention.
.
The video went viral and concerned BTS fans from all over the world sent thousands of inspiring messages to help #EncourageEsther. Her nurses hung some of the comments in her room to share some positivity and help restore her will to fight.
.
Esther's care team said the overwhelming support given to her from all over the globe helped rejuvenate her spirits. She began responding well to treatment, and she was able to be removed from life support.
.
Thank you to #BTS community and Esther\xe2\x80\x99s amazing care givers who went above and beyond in offering superior patient care. We are thrilled to announce she has beat COVID-19 and left for rehab at Methodist Hospital | Texsan.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #BTSArmy"

b'Our patients show us how to be strong and courageous while we work to provide a safe, compassionate care experience for anyone who seeks it. Meet our brave patient, Jay Middleton, who recently completed six-weeks of radiation treatment at the @sarahcannoncancer Institute at @swedishmedicalcenter after being diagnosed with neck and oral cancer.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cSwedish Medical Center has been my home away from home since surgery on February 20th. I can\xe2\x80\x99t even begin to express the gratitude for how well the staff has treated me and my family,\xe2\x80\x9d said Jay.
.
Determined to live his \xe2\x80\x9cbest outdoor life with or without cancer\xe2\x80\x9d, Jay \xe2\x80\x93 an avid bike enthusiast \xe2\x80\x93 recently completed a 30 mile #30for30 bike ride. One mile for each day of his radiation therapy treatment. In addition, Jay created stickers to raise awareness for cancer research, with proceeds going to the Sarah Cannon Fund.
.
We are all rooting for you Jay! Your strength drives us to seek and embrace innovative approaches to the care and improvement of human life.
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #HealthierTomorrows #FightingCancerTogether'

b'Our values come to life every day when we provide patient care with dignity, compassion, and competence to anyone who needs it, no matter the patient\xe2\x80\x99s individual circumstance.
.
Our values come to life every day when we foster a work environment where everyone is treated with respect and loyalty and has an equal chance to succeed and grow.
.
Our values come to life when we support our communities and those in need.
.
We believe excellence in healthcare starts with these values as a foundation. Therefore, we aim not to discriminate. We aim not to harm; instead, we aim to nurture and support. Events unfolding throughout our nation go against these values and have many of us hurting, anxious, and concerned for one another, our families, and our communities. Our commitment to a diverse and inclusive organization is not passive; it is active.
.
Click the :link: in bio to read more.'

b'During his 61-day stay at Los Robles Regional Medical Center, COVID-19 patient Miguel Cerezo was sent messages of strength from his family. As he fought the virus in a medically induced coma on a ventilator, his nurses read the notes, hoping he could hear the loving words of encouragement from his family.
.
As he healed, Miguel began to read the letters himself. He says this motivated him to stay strong and one day return to his family. This past week, hospital staff cheered him on as he was reunited with his family. "From the bottom of my heart- I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t be anymore grateful," said Miguel.
.
For Miguel\xe2\x80\x99s care team members, the reunion was a heartfelt reminder of the lives they\xe2\x80\x99re saving. "To see his family and for us to wish him well, it\xe2\x80\x99s one of the biggest triumphs of our careers," said HCA Healthcare nurse Tom Vasko.
.
Click the :link: in bio for the full story.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily'

b'HCA Healthcare delivers approximately 220,000 babies each year. Recently, we had the privilege of welcoming two very special bundles of joy to the HCA Healthcare family.
.
Congratulations to Hillary Kennison and Taylor Taylor, labor and delivery nurses at affiliate @fairviewparkhospital, who had the same due date and both delivered their babies at their hometown hospital in Dublin, Ga. Welcome to the world Stella Jade Kennison and Ellis Greer Taylor! :baby::baby:
.
\xe2\x80\x9cAs a labor nurse I can tell you my biggest concern now is that mothers still get the beautiful and positive birth experience they\xe2\x80\x99ve dreamt about,\xe2\x80\x9d said Taylor. \xe2\x80\x9cI hope that expectant mothers can find comfort in knowing that their safety is our priority and that we are here for them.\xe2\x80\x9d After delivering, she added, \xe2\x80\x9cI am so appreciative of the extra precautions Fairview put in place during my delivery. While we missed our family, Matt and I had special bonding time with Ellis because of the limited visitation restrictions. The entire Women's Center team made us feel safe and protected the entire time."
.
Thank you to Hillary, Taylor and all of our caregivers who are committed to making the delivery experience safe and special for all of our expectant moms.
.
.
.
#HCAWomens #HCABabies #CaringDuringCOVID19'

b':ambulance: Time-sensitive emergency health needs don\xe2\x80\x99t stop for a pandemic, and neither do we. HCA Healthcare experts urge that waiting too long to seek care for conditions like heart attack and stroke can mean the difference between life and death.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re able to act on those types of emergencies with early interventions and have better outcomes, but when people delay care, it can become life threatening,\xe2\x80\x9d says Dr. Travis Graves, a hospitalist at affiliate TriStar Skyline Medical Center in Nashville, Tenn.
.
Tap the :link: in bio to find out what conditions warrant immediate attention PLUS learn about precautionary measures taking place across our organization to ensure that patients can safely receive the care they need.
.
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #CaringDuringCOVID19 #EmergencyCare'

b'Tears have been shed across our nation during the #COVID19 pandemic. But, on a Friday afternoon at @centerpointmedcenter :hospital: in Independence, Mo., tears of joy were shed during a memorable \xe2\x80\x93 and unconventional \xe2\x80\x93 wedding celebration for HCA Healthcare patient, Mike McBride, and his bride Melonne.
.
Mike and Melonne had set May 15 as their wedding day and, amidst COVID-19, were planning a quiet ceremony at a church that included only a few family members. But that all changed three weeks ago when Mike, a civilian worker at the Kansas City Missouri Police Department, was struck by a vehicle while he was driving to work early in the morning. Determined to let the couple keep their date, colleagues at the hospital\xe2\x80\x99s rehabilitation center sprang into action and surprised them with a wedding cake, punch, decorations and a whole lot of love. Tears began to roll down his cheeks when Mike, who arrived to the outdoor hospital ceremony in a wheelchair, saw his 5-year-old son in attendance.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cIt was a special occasion,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dr. Jared Smith, general surgeon at Centerpoint Medical Center. \xe2\x80\x9cThey are such a wonderful family, and Mike has been through so much. This is just perfect.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
Thank you, Mike and Melonne, for letting us share in your special day! :bouquet:
.
.
.
 #CareLikeFamily #CaringDuringCOVID19'

b'After a 58 day stay at affiliate @henricodoctorshospital, we celebrate 100-year-old WWII veteran, Lloyd Falk, who was discharged this week after beating #COVID19.
.
Mr. Falk was admitted on March 24 as one of the hospital\xe2\x80\x99s first COVID-19 patients. Despite losing his wife of 74 years to the virus a few weeks ago, he continued to stay strong, defying the odds and surviving his fight against COVID-19.
.
We salute Mr. Falk, who is an inspiration to so many, and the caregivers at Henrico Doctors\xe2\x80\x99 Hospital for their dedication and resilience.
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #CaringDuringCOVID19 #HealthierTomorrows #Veteran #Recovery .

b'Meet Andrew Kalvelage, an 18-year-old HCA Healthcare patient who surprised our hospital team at @rmhcfamily when he arrived for his surgical procedure in a tux! :man_in_tuxedo:
.
Andrew normally wears his formal wear when he\xe2\x80\x99s performing alto sax and tuba alongside his high school bandmates. But, a sensitive medical condition left him wanting to wear his black-and-whites to an event of a different kind: surgery. "When I put a tux on, I know I am going somewhere good. Once I had the tux on, I wasn't nervous at all," said Andrew.
.
After a quick growth spurt in his teens where he grew 8\xe2\x80\x9d in one year, Andrew and his family noticed that his chest wall was becoming deformed. He was experiencing a condition called pectus excavatum \xe2\x80\x93 a structural deformity that produces a sunken appearance in the chest. While, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t bother Andrew, when the medical information came back about his condition, he decided it was time for surgery. The news that his chest wall was touching his heart and affecting his health (his lips would even turn blue while playing sports) was the deciding factor. He found Dr. Steve Rothenberg and the Chest Deformity Clinic at Rocky Mountain Hospital for Children. He underwent a Nuss procedure to insert a metal bar temporarily to help reshape his chest. The bar was taken out this week during outpatient surgery.
.
While we work to make sure that our sites of care are safe for everyone that walks through our doors, we are so happy that patients like Andrew can bring smiles to our faces!
.
.
#HealthierTomorrows #CaringDuringCOVID19 #Surgery'

b'According to the @cdcgov, more than 795,000 people experience a stroke\xe2\x80\x94one of the most time-sensitive medical conditions\xe2\x80\x94every year in the U.S. Fast treatment is crucial to saving a life, and in 2019, we were proud to announce that HCA Healthcare hospitals collectively respond to strokes 30% faster than the national standard.
.
#DYK that 80% of strokes are preventable? Living healthy today is the best way to ensure a healthier tomorrow. Take charge of your health and learn about five ways to lower your risk factor for stroke.
.
.
.
#StrokeAwarenessMonth #HealthierTomorrows'

b'Shelly Berryhill is a well-known face in Hawkinsville, Georgia. The local community rallied around Shelly, a city commissioner and church deacon, when he tested positive for #COVID19 in March.
.
While he was on a ventilator for nearly a month, a letter from Shelly\xe2\x80\x99s daughter, Kristen, brought the city and colleagues at @coliseumhealthga to their knees.
.
Thanking those who put their lives on the line to save her father\xe2\x80\x99s life, Kristen starts the letter with: \xe2\x80\x9cA huge hello to all you angels that are working so hard to save my daddy\xe2\x80\x99s life.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
#WATCH Kristen\xe2\x80\x99s touching tribute to her dad and the kind words that motivated hospital colleagues to fight for Shelly. That hard-fought battle has been won. We are happy to report that, as of last week, Shelly is back home with his family!
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #CaringDuringCOVID19'

b'In one of the toughest battles of his life, airline pilot and @usnavy veteran, Fernando Vizcarrando, fought COVID-19 at affiliate Orange Park Medical Center.
.
During his six week stay at the hospital, colleagues cared for Fernando like family. They used their skill and expertise to deliver critical medical care. They played tic-tac-toe with him through a window to conquer isolation. They lined hospital hallways and cheered for Fernando as he graduated from the ICU. And, they beamed with pride and clapped loudly as he was wheeled out of the hospital to be reunited with his family.
.
Fernando has been recovering in inpatient rehab center for the last 12 days and is being discharged HOME today.
.
Congratulations, Fernando! Your courage and resilience inspire us to live out our mission to care for and improve human life.
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HealthierTomorrows #Recovery #Veteran'

b'Three months in to the pandemic, we find ourselves in the middle of Mental Health Month, observed annually in May. \xe2\x80\x9cCOVID-19 has exposed each of us to an array of emotions \xe2\x80\x95 grief, fear, anxiety, loss and loneliness. b'HCA Healthcare is proud to be recognized as a John M. Eisenberg Patient Safety and Quality Awards recipient for innovation by The Joint Commission and the National Quality Forum for our pioneering work using artificial intelligence to help reduce sepsis mortality. .
\xe2\x80\x9cThe current public health climate of COVID-19 has emphasized now more than ever the importance of early detection of life-threatening illnesses,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dr. Jonathan Perlin, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s chief medical officer and president, clinical services group. \xe2\x80\x9cWe are honored to receive this respected award for our technology that helps clinicians detect sepsis earlier, accelerates treatment, improves the care provided to patients, and helps save lives.\xe2\x80\x9d

.
.

b"\xe2\x80\x9cThey can see our eyes...they can see the energy and spark, but they can't see the smile,\xe2\x80\x9d says Jeff Seely, an HCA Healthcare ICU nurse that has served at @tristarcentennial for nearly 30 years. b'\xe2\x80\x9cWe are in it together. You are not alone\xe2\x80\x9d. b'\xe2\x80\x9cVery few people can do what frontline workers do. Physically, some could handle it. Mentally, that is where most fall short. Those that can toe-the-line at the front feel an unmistakable need to run in when everyone is running out. That is the common denominator of a front line worker,\xe2\x80\x9d says HCA Healthcare emergency room nurse, Owen Rogers.
.
As #NursesWeek kicks off, Owen, who serves at @plantationgeneral :hospital: in Florida spoke with @cheddar  about his journey from front line worker to front line patient after a CT scan revealed a massive brain tumor in July of 2019. With the support of his immediate and hospital family, Owen made it through emergency surgery and radiation. With a large bald spot and a 12-inch scar on the side of his head, Owen asked for his spot back on the front line.
.
Now on the front lines of COVID-19, Owen says, \xe2\x80\x9cNo one knows how they will react to combat until combat arrives. When it arrived at Plantation General Hospital, we were ready and fought tooth and nail for the lives in our care. It\xe2\x80\x99s what we do. Combat has brought out the best in all of us.  When there was no play book, we wrote one. Our families apart, our schools, businesses and streets quiet. When words weren\xe2\x80\x99t enough our actions carried our message of hope, renewal, patience, love and compassion.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
#WATCH Owen\xe2\x80\x99s full interview with Cheddar at the :link: in bio.
.
.
.
#NursesWeek2020 #YearOfTheNurse #CaringDuringCOVID19'

b"#ICYMI TriStar Skyline Medical Center's dancing duo was recently featured on @dailymailtv, hosted by former NFL QB Jesse Palmer. Meg Gegen, an HCA Healthcare occupational therapist, took a unique approach to get 81-year-old #COVID19 patient Travis Groves on his feet again.
.
After Meg found out from Travis\xe2\x80\x99 daughter that he was known for his dance moves, she worked with him every day to recover from coronavirus and build up strength through dancing. When Travis was discharged from the hospital, Meg came back, on her day off, to tell him goodbye. The duo did one last dance together \xe2\x80\x93 this time to Billy Ray Cyrus\xe2\x80\x99 \xe2\x80\x9cAchy Breaky Heart\xe2\x80\x9d. We wish Travis continued success in his recovery and can\xe2\x80\x99t wait to see him out on the dance floor again!

b'HCA Healthcare intensive care unit (ICU) nurse, Sean Brennan, cares for #COVID19 patients at affiliate @methodisthealthcaresa. Prior to serving our patients, he served as a medic in the @usarmy. Sean takes a moment to share his duty and honor to care like no other during these past few months\xe2\x80\xa6
.
SEAN: \xe2\x80\x9cWhen this disease hit San Antonio, I immediately volunteered to treat positive coronavirus patients. I felt a calling to be back at the \xe2\x80\x98tip of the spear\xe2\x80\x99 ready to defend my country, once again. I had to beat this threat to our nation, our culture and our way of life.
.
One of the first COVID-19 positive patients I treated was Dave. Dave came to Methodist Hospital and was quickly intubated. He ended up coding, challenging us to develop a solution to resuscitate him in a COVID-19 environment, which we successfully did. There were days we thought he would not make it. I purchased a Bluetooth speaker for his room and every day called his family on my personal phone I had in a zip lock bag so the voices of his family could bring him a sense of comfort and healing.
.
He\xe2\x80\x99s tested negative twice now for COVID-19 and has regained his neurological function in large, physically getting stronger every day. Not only did he come out of it, but he\xe2\x80\x99s on track to get his life back. Something COVID-19 cannot take away from us is our positive results; no one can turn around and undo what we\xe2\x80\x99ve all done. These patients impact our lives just as much as we save theirs.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HCAVeterans #Nursing #Army #Hero'

b'The human race has faced an enemy like no other these last few months, one that has made time stand still for our nation and our world. Never in our lifetimes have we faced a crisis like this one.
.
We have been stretched to imagine a new way of life, a new normal. Stretched, but not broken. Each day that passes brings the hope of a healthier tomorrow. Through it all, HCA Healthcare has remained focused on one thing \xe2\x80\x93 the care and improvement of human life.
.

#Forward #HealthierTomorrows'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cWhen I saw light again, it was the most beautiful feeling.\xe2\x80\x9d Alex Melo \xe2\x80\x93 husband, father, and retired 20-year Marine :United_States:\xe2\x80\x93 was discharged from affiliate @portsmouthregionalhospital in New Hampshire after spending 13 days in the hospital with #COVID19. The day he was released from the hospital, the elevator doors opened in the lobby and Alex was shocked to see lines of doctors and nurses clapping for him and waving goodbye.
.
He stood up to honor his caregivers and said: \xe2\x80\x9cI want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for all the work that you have done. Thank God for all the patience he gives you, for all the strength, for the support that you are giving, for sacrificing your time, your life, to be on the frontline for us, so you can save us and keep us out of here. And this is the result of your effort. Thank you very much. God bless you.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
.
.
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #HealthierTomorrows #Marines #Veteran #Recovery #Hope'

b'In a time where many are isolated, simple acts of compassion from HCA #HealthcareHeroes are bringing comfort to patients and their families.

.
Thank you to Al, and all of our caregivers, for creating beautiful patient experiences during this unprecedented time. Your warmth, humanity and resilience keep us all going.
.
.

#PatientExperience #PX2020 #CareLikeFamily #CaringDuringCOVID19'

b"HCA Healthcare nurse Angelina Villasenor takes a moment to reflect on #CaringDuringCOVID19:
.
ANGELINA: \xe2\x80\x9cI recently sat with a patient. She was scared. I helped talk her through how she should isolate, what to look out for and answered her questions. She began crying, thinking of how this virus could impact her in the coming days. I reached out and held her hand.
.
Being a nurse during these uncertain times is challenging. However, for me it highlights why I became a nurse. Regardless of how scary or confusing it is out there, or a prognosis or condition is, we are here. I am here for my patients, their family members, and my coworkers. I have always felt my purpose for being a nurse is to make just one person's day better. During these times it is no different. Patients are alone, family members separated, and rules ever-changing. We can support and comfort our patients and their family members through our words and actions. Holding a hand and saying a prayer may be the most compassionate and necessary action at that moment.\xe2\x80\x9d - Angelina Villasenor, RN @methodisthealthcaresa (San Antonio, TX)
.
.
.
#CareLikeFamily #HCANursing #Nursing #Care"

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThe COVID testing that we\xe2\x80\x99ve been involved in has made all the difference. We are trying to bring information and light to people who might be anxious and fearful about the situation around them. I\xe2\x80\x99m grateful to be a part of this profession. We are definitely on the front lines, making a difference\xe2\x80\x94giving people answers so that they can move on with their lives. Our work removes the doubt for people\xe2\x80\x94its key to getting us back to normal.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 Barbara Blanke, lab director at HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s Timpanogos Regional Hospital in Orem, Utah.\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n#LabWeek #CaringDuringCOVID19 #Lab #Testing'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to fight the global #COVID19 pandemic alongside our research arm, @sarahcannoncancer. 172 HCA Healthcare hospitals, spanning 20 states, are taking part in a national treatment study \xe2\x80\x93 using plasma from recovered COVID-19 patients. The antibodies in the plasma from recovered COVID-19 patients may help critically ill patients fight the virus. One donation could potentially help several COVID-19 patients.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cAs a learning healthcare system that serves communities across the country, we are proud to play a part in broader global public health initiatives, including this and other research, to identify effective COVID-19 treatments,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dr. Jonathan Perlin, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s chief medical officer. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re encouraging the communities HCA Healthcare serves to join us in this important effort to help identify donors.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
:right_arrow_selector:Learn more about our commitment to improve COVID-19 patient care and outcomes at the :link: in bio.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#ImproveMoreLives #ClinicalResearch #Treatment'

b'As we cope with new ways of living \xe2\x80\x94 flattening the curve, social distancing \xe2\x80\x94 our HCA Healthcare family, first responders and essential workers remind us that we\xe2\x80\x99re never alone. We\xe2\x80\x99re all connected through kindness, compassion and gratitude. Thank you to everyone staying home during #COVID19, social distancing and checking in on those in need. #HealthierTomorrows'

b'During #COVID19, HCA Healthcare caregivers have banded together to support our patients in an unbreakable and powerful way. Our collective mission to care for and improve human life has never been more real. And, sometimes, it\xe2\x80\x99s the small things that we do to shape the patient experience that mean the most.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Recently our @methodisthealthcaresa | Stone Oak Rehabilitation Team arranged a special birthday party for one of our patients and his family, while keeping everyone safe. Happy tears were shed and sweet memories were made.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cWe have become family to patients during this unique time. Caring like family is remembering the little things \xe2\x80\x93 the things that a family member would do such as spending time talking, really listening, being present in the moment and advocating for their needs. It means genuinely caring for a person\xe2\x80\x99s health, happiness and well-being. It means going above and beyond to make a person feel like they are at home.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 Angela Almaguer RN, BSN, Methodist Hospital | Stone Oak Nursing Manager for Inpatient Rehab
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #PositiveImpact'

b'Meet HCA Healthcare surgical services director Kate Lee. She serves our patients at affiliate @CapitalRegionalmc in Tallahassee, Fla. \xe2\x80\x93 and \xe2\x80\x93 also serves our country as a @americasnavy reservist. A few weeks ago, Kate was called to New York along with 500 other Navy Reserve medical professionals in the battle against #COVID19.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Her journey began at the Javits Federal Medical Station where an initial training took place and was then deployed to a hospital in Brooklyn. Kate is working on a support team for the ICU nurses \xe2\x80\x93 taking care of the sickest of patients. The days are long and exhausting, but she\xe2\x80\x99s proud to protect the American people and carry out our mission: Above all else, we are committed to the care and improvement of human life.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Kate is supported by her husband, Ben, and her son, Aidan. They keep in touch via FaceTime, and it\xe2\x80\x99s those moments that give Kate strength.
\xe2\x80\xa2
We\xe2\x80\x99re honored to have Kate as part of the HCA Healthcare family. Thank you, Kate, for your service, courage and commitment to #CaringDuringCOVID19.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CareLikeFamily #PositiveImpact #Navy #Reservist #Service #HealthcareHeroes'

b':microscope::dna::petri_dish:Please join us in celebrating the tireless efforts of our HCA Healthcare lab teams as they continue to be a guiding light through the global pandemic. Our dedicated laboratory professionals provide valuable clinical data used to screen, diagnose, treat and monitor diseases. And, during #COVID19, they\xe2\x80\x99re working tirelessly to make sure every sample that is collected gets processed, tested and reported to physicians in a timely manner.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cLaboratory professionals are an essential part of the healthcare world. We may be \xe2\x80\x98behind-the-scenes\xe2\x80\x99, but HCA Healthcare gives us the opportunity to contribute our knowledge and expertise in caring for patients in our facilities and for our communities. We have great people working in the lab field!\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 Kay Creed, lab director at affiliate @gulfcoastregionalmedicalcenter.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Happy #LabWeek to the fearless team behind the results.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#LabWeek2020 #CaringDuringCOVID19'

b":globe_showing_Americas: April 22, 2020 marks the 50th anniversary of #EarthDay. While the observance looks a little different this year, HCA Healthcare stands committed to protecting our colleagues and communities through environmental sustainability efforts.
\xe2\x80\xa2
As a founding member of Practice Greenhealth's Healthier Hospitals Initiative, we know that healthy communities are connected to healthy environments. In 2019, our environmental task forces championed:
:recycling_symbol_selector: recycling of 129M+ pounds of construction waste
:recycling_symbol_selector: recycling of 31.9M+ pounds of cardboard, paper, aluminum, wood and rechargeable batteries
:recycling_symbol_selector:1.1M+ pounds of devices diverted from landfill for reprocessing
\xe2\x80\xa2
Although we remain physically distant on this 50th anniversary of Earth Day, we can still feel connected and inspired across HCA Healthcare in our shared commitment to #HealthierTomorrows.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#EarthDay #PositiveImpact"

We will get through this together.

b'#CaringDuringCOVID19 takes teamwork. From nursing to Information Technology (IT), multi-disciplinary teams each play a critical role in patient care. We are so proud of how our caregivers continue to adapt and work together to give our patients and their loved ones the best experience possible.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cAs challenging as the hospital world may be, I cannot imagine how hard this is for families! Our incredible IT team has helped to bridge the gap and make a way for families to be able to see their loved ones....to talk to them (even when they may not be able to talk back); to pray over them; to see what the room looks like; to see who we are (not just another voice on the end of the phone); and in some cases, to allow families the gift of saying \xe2\x80\x9cgoodbye.\xe2\x80\x9d I cannot tell you what a HUGE blessing this has been! These circumstances surely haven\xe2\x80\x99t been easy to adjust to or navigate, but we are figuring it out one day at a time. I am so thankful that we are making a way for the families and patients to interact, even if it\xe2\x80\x99s through a screen,\xe2\x80\x9d said Stephanie Intorcia, ICU nurse with affiliate @coliseumhealthga.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#COVID19 #CareLikeFamily #HCANursing #HCATechnology #InformationTechnology #Communication'

b'At HCA Healthcare, we consider nurses the lifeblood of our organization. They go above and beyond the call of duty to care for our patients, ensuring a nurturing environment where patients feel safe, even during the most difficult of times.
\xe2\x80\xa2
To guard against the spread of #COVID19 in our facilities, affiliate @tristarcentennial \xe2\x80\x93 like all hospitals in our organization \xe2\x80\x93 instituted new visitor control policies. Unfortunately, this means that many patients are spending time away from their loved ones. Oncology nurse, Savannah Oddo, recognized the struggle her patients were experiencing during this time of isolation and social distancing.
\xe2\x80\xa2
To help @sarahcannoncancer patients stay connected, Savannah organized a virtual painting class! :artist_palette::adult:\xe2\x80\x8d:laptop_computer::framed_picture:
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cIt was nice getting to see other people that are currently on the unit and going through the same thing,\xe2\x80\x9d a patient of Savannah\xe2\x80\x99s said. \xe2\x80\x9cEven though you know others are up here, it can feel very isolating because you\xe2\x80\x99re the only person in your room.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you to #HealthcareHeroes, like Savannah, for their commitment to compassionate care in the wake of COVID-19. We need you more than ever.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #HCANursing #FightingCancerTogether #PatientCare #Art #OncologyNurse'

b'Across HCA Healthcare, chaplains are working in our hospitals to ensure patients, families and colleagues are spiritually and emotionally supported during the pandemic.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#WATCH a behind-the-scenes video of a chaplain\xe2\x80\x99s prayer in a Medical City Healthcare #COVID19 unit\xe2\x80\x94and the caregivers who bowed their heads for wisdom and healing.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #Hope #Faith #Healing'

b"Today, you're being challenged like never before, yet you remain focused and positive, always working toward a healthier tomorrow.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Your resilience is what keeps us all going. It's what makes us.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#Gratitude #CaringDuringCOVID19"

b'For HCA Healthcare nurse Melissa Antolin, #COVID19 is very real and very raw. She works in the coronavirus ward at affiliate West Hills Hospital and Medical Center :hospital: in West Hills, California.
\xe2\x80\xa2
But, as she pulls in to the hospital parking lot each morning, she\xe2\x80\x99s reminded that she\xe2\x80\x99s not alone in the fight against this invisible and unfamiliar enemy. Melissa looks up, and reads a billboard that says: \xe2\x80\x9cWe stand ready, we stand together.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re ready, we can do this,\xe2\x80\x9d she thinks to herself. \xe2\x80\x9cWe have everything that we need, and as long as we\xe2\x80\x99re working together, we can definitely handle whatever comes our way. Our hospital has provided us with the necessary tools.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
And, as patients await their test results, she lifts them up in compassion. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99ve already planned for this, so in that way, at least if they\xe2\x80\x99re nervous or they\xe2\x80\x99re scared about having to fight this virus, at least we can reassure them that we have a plan and that we know what we\xe2\x80\x99re doing to take care of them,\xe2\x80\x9d adds Melissa.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you to Melissa, and all of our front line heroes, for #CaringDuringCOVID19.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#HCANursing #CareLikeFamily'

b'#WATCH as North Florida Regional Medical Center discharges its first #COVID19 patient \xe2\x80\x93 one who our colleagues affectionately refer to as \xe2\x80\x9cThe Amazing Henry\xe2\x80\x9d because of his miraculous recovery. However, he attributes his recovery to his HCA Healthcare heroes.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cReal guardian angels\xe2\x80\xa6 I met them at North Florida Regional Hospital. They were here with me through the miracle,\xe2\x80\x9d said Henry James.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you to all our dedicated colleagues who are providing superior care on the front lines.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #Recovery'

b'Dr. Robert Smith, associate chief medical officer at affiliate @sunrisehealthlv :hospital: stands by screening tents near his hospital\xe2\x80\x99s emergency room entrance. Even though our campuses may look different during this unprecedented time, our mission remains the same: Above all else, we are committed to the care and improvement of human life.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99ve had a rolling strategy of how to contend with coronavirus as it has expanded,\xe2\x80\x9d says Dr. Smith.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Dr. Smith has taken valuable lessons about social distancing and threat mitigation from HCA Healthcare \xe2\x80\x9csister facilities in Florida and San Jose that have been impacted more than we have, just learning what things we need to plan for moving forward.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Join us in thanking our strong community of colleagues and physicians who are working tirelessly on behalf of our patients.
\xe2\x80\xa2
 #CaringDuringCOVID19 #ImproveMoreLives'

b'During #COVID19, pharmacists play a critical role in patient care and public health. We applaud pharmacists across HCA Healthcare who are helping to educate, mitigate, test, treat, and respond to the pandemic.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so grateful to HCA Healthcare for keeping me safe with universal masking and for giving me access to the most up to date literature about COVID-19 therapies,\xe2\x80\x9d says Jamal Mourad, a pharmacist and #HealthcareHero at affiliate Medical City Frisco. In her role, she serves as a source of vital COVID-19 information and support.
\xe2\x80\xa2
To our entire HCA Healthcare family, thank you for your unwavering dedication, your tremendous sacrifice and hard work. Our colleagues are true heroes.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily'

\xe2\x80\xa2
During the global #COVID19 pandemic, HCA Healthcare UK is providing care to National Health Service (@nhswebsite) patients whose care and clinical needs are considered time-critical. \xe2\x80\x9cWe are deeply honored to have this opportunity to be part of the national response to the coronavirus pandemic,\xe2\x80\x9d adds Reay.

b'#ICYMI: Watch as celebrity chef @emeril serves up meals to HCA Healthcare heroes. \xe2\x80\x9cI believe in the power of food to express love and kindness and to bring people together,\xe2\x80\x9d says Emeril. \xe2\x80\x9cToday, I\xe2\x80\x99ve partnered with @goodmorningamerica to feed our amazing doctors and nurses at @tulanehealthsystem.\xe2\x80\x9d

b'\xe2\x80\x9cOne of the guiding principles we had when we went into this COVID-19 battle was to find partnerships\xe2\x80\x94partnerships with other components of the healthcare industry, partnerships with other health systems and partnerships with governments, both local and federal. We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to be part of this public-private sector partnership, and I think it\xe2\x80\x99s going to do great good for the community,\xe2\x80\x9d said HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s chief executive officer, Sam Hazen, when addressing President Trump, officials and members of the media at an announcement of the \xe2\x80\x9cDynamic Ventilator Reserve\xe2\x80\x9d at the @WhiteHouse.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Click the :link: in bio to learn more about our commitment to provide as many as 1,000 ventilators through a new program that will allow hospitals to ship unused machines to areas where they are needed most to fight #COVID19.

We have rapidly expanded telehealth capabilities to support our clinical staff and meet the needs of our patients. b'Our dedication to caring like family extends beyond our hospitals\xe2\x80\x99 walls into the communities where we live and work. During #COVID19, we are proud to strengthen relationships with neighbors in our hometowns. The HCA Healthcare Foundation, the philanthropic arm of HCA Healthcare, and a tax exempt trust affiliated with HCA Healthcare will provide more than $1 million in grants to local community organizations to aid in COVID-19 relief efforts.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cLike our colleagues that are serving on the frontlines of this crisis by providing lifesaving care to patients, local organizations are also stepping up to address the needs of their communities in remarkable ways, including emergency response, addressing food shortages and providing childcare for healthcare workers and first responders,\xe2\x80\x9d said Sam Hazen, chief executive officer of HCA Healthcare. \xe2\x80\x9cHCA Healthcare is honored to support our communities during this unprecedented time of rapidly changing needs.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Learn more at the :link: in bio.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HCACares #ImproveMoreLives #Community #Neighbors'

b'Across the country, HCA Healthcare colleagues breathe life, courage and strength into our communities. In return, our communities have shown an abundance of gratitude and support that has re-energized every shift, day and night.

b'At the heart of everything we do, we #CareLikeFamily. Colleagues at affiliate @MountainViewHospitalLV are embodying this during #COVID19 by checking up on more than 150 volunteers with "connection calls" each week until volunteers can return to their roles at the hospital.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cMany of our volunteers rely on MountainView Hospital as much as we rely on them,\xe2\x80\x9d says Ana Vides, director of volunteer services. \xe2\x80\x9cFor many, MountainView is their social support system, as well as a way to bring joy to their lives. We want to make sure that our volunteers, many who are elderly and live alone, are OK during this time of social distancing.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #PositiveImpact'

b'#WATCH as colleagues at affiliate Presbyterian/St. Luke's Medical Center gathered for the discharge of the first COVID-19 patient admitted to their hospital. Even more compelling to the story\xe2\x80\x93 the patient they saved? A colleague of 36 years!
\xe2\x80\xa2
Cherpao Lee holds a special place in the staff\xe2\x80\x99s hearts as he\xe2\x80\x99s worked at the hospital for 36 years as part of the food and nutrition services team.
\xe2\x80\xa2
While Lee contracted the virus in the community, he knew his hospital family would take good care of him.
\xe2\x80\xa2
"I want to thank all of the nurses, the doctors and the food services team for providing for me and helping me with this. It has been a difficult time, but I know a lot of people care about me and pray for me, and I want to thank them," Lee said.
\xe2\x80\xa2
We are grateful for Mr. Lee\xe2\x80\x99s recovery and hope to see him back soon, just not as a patient! Thank you to our caregivers who continue to #CareLikeFamily in the midst of #COVID19.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Click the :link: in bio to learn more.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #MotivationMonday #Recovery'
