b'#COVID19 is unlike anything we\xe2\x80\x99ve seen in modern medicine. Willing to learn, ready to fight, colleagues across the country are stepping up to serve our patients in new ways. Normally, HCA Healthcare nurse Amy Huffman works in the operating room at affiliate @tristarcentennial. Today, her role in the hospital looks a little different. Earlier this week, Amy took a moment to jot down her commitment to care.
.
.
.
AMY: \xe2\x80\x9cThis morning I got a phone call from my coordinator. She had a question for me. She said that I should not feel pressured into doing this, but I was one of the nurses that the surgeon felt comfortable with in these situations. The question was, \xe2\x80\x98Would I be willing to be on the tracheostomy team for COVID-19 patients?\xe2\x80\x99
\xe2\x80\xa2
There was no question in my mind on my answer. Without hesitation, my answer was, \xe2\x80\x98YES\xe2\x80\x99.
\xe2\x80\xa2
This is what we do. We work hard to save lives if we can. I\xe2\x80\x99ve had friends say that they are keeping me in their prayers. My only prayer is that the patients we do a tracheostomy on live. That is the only thanks we need. We are these helpless individuals\xe2\x80\x99 advocates. We care for them like they are our family, that is why we became nurses.
\xe2\x80\xa2
The compassion that we feel for our patients, and the passion that we have for our job is what gets us out of bed every morning. It keeps us going in times of crisis. Whether it is a code blue, a death of a favorite patient, the flu epidemic, or COVID-19. We\xe2\x80\x99ve been there. Exhausted, hungry, holding back tears. We just keep going.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
.
.
Thank you, Amy, for #CaringDuringCOVID19.
#Gratitude #HCANursing #Nursing #Care #Hospital #Nashville'

b'A viral video of @southernhillshospitallv #COVID19 patient, Alfred, has gained the attention of @foxnews. As Alfred is headed home in a wheelchair, he's seen giving thumbs up's and waves to the dozens of colleagues who lined the hospital hallways.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cYou guys gave me a second chance at life. I could never thank you enough," Alfred said to his #HealthcareHeroes. "You are putting your lives on the line for all of us, and I really appreciate that."
\xe2\x80\xa2
At the :link: in bio, #WATCH as Dr. Christopher Voscopoulos, ICU medical director, shares the uplifting story of successfully treating one of the most critical cases of COVID-19 the hospital has seen to date.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you to our colleagues at Southern Hills Hospital and Medical Center, and to all those on the front lines, who continue to remain hopeful and provide superior care during this critical time.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #Resilience #FeelGoodFriday #GoodNews'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s times like these that show what you\xe2\x80\x99re made of. At HCA Healthcare, what we\xe2\x80\x99re made of is incredible people.

Passionate people who care without reservation or limits. Courageous people who show up ready to face new challenges daily. People who protect vigilantly, give selflessly and support one another tirelessly. People who bring calm to chaos. People like you.

For each and every one of our colleagues, we are forever grateful.

Thank you.

#Gratitude #CaringDuringCOVID19'

b'Fueling the fight. Taking time to care for others comes natural for our Food and Nutrition Services team at affiliate @stdavidshealthcare. In the midst of #COVID19, they set up a colleague grocery store in their cafeteria for those on the front lines to purchase staples that are becoming harder to find. Tami Taylor, chief nursing officer, was just one of many colleagues who was able to pick up food for her family.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cDuring times like this, it is wonderful to see the innovation and collaboration of our teams. Our Food and Nutrition Services Director, Beth Bowles, is taking care of our staff while we work to care for our community. I am a proud HCA Healthcare colleague every day, and once again, they are showing all of us, in big ways, what it means to care like family.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
#COVID19 #CaringDuringCOVID19 #HCANursing #Nutrition'

b'What an incredible gesture by former @nfl QB Peyton Manning and his wife, Ashley. In true MVP form, the Mannings graciously sent lunch to HCA Healthcare colleagues caring for #COVID19 patients at @tulanehealthsystem.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cAs healthcare workers on the front lines, you are all demonstrating great courage and commitment and making great personal sacrifices to care for the sick during this national crisis,\xe2\x80\x9d Peyton says in a candid cell phone message to HCA Healthcare caregivers. \xe2\x80\x9cThank you, be well and strong and keep up the great work.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Ruth Kain, chief nursing officer of Tulane Health System acknowledges uplifting gestures like this as key to reinforcing resilience: \xe2\x80\x9cWhile the food fills their bellies and the messages fill their hearts, it\xe2\x80\x99s the knowledge that our community is rallying around our healthcare teams that helps us get through the difficult days.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #HealthcareHeroes #PeytonManning'

b'During this novel coronavirus outbreak, our patients and communities continue to look for guidance, and colleagues like Sara Ress are answering the call\xe2\x80\x94literally. Sara, a HCA Healthcare call center triage nurse, and her team are answering #COVID19 and other routine calls 24 hours a day, 7 days a week to provide our patients with reliable information, guidance for seeking care, and calming reassurance during this time of uncertainty.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cIt is important now, more than ever, to route and instruct patients correctly so they receive timely and proper treatment,\xe2\x80\x9d says Sara who is based out of HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s headquarters in Nashville, Tenn. \xe2\x80\x9cOur responsibility is to direct our patients to appropriate care, i.e. home treatment, primary care, urgent care, the emergency room, or 9-1-1 when warranted. I am grateful to serve in this facet where caring like family for our patients in turn enhances our front line teams.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you to Sara and our national call center teams who continue to support our communities and front line staff around-the-clock.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily'

b'HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s supply chain continually evolves to meet the needs of our caregivers and patients\xe2\x80\x94especially during times of adversity.  Our supply chain is committed to delivering results that improve the patient experience and is a department that takes teamwork, organization and technology to keep the right supplies on hand and up to date.
\xe2\x80\xa2
In the midst of #COVID19, the supply chain team at affiliate @fairviewparkhospital :hospital: in Dublin, Ga., has been hard at work supporting our facility teams with resources they need to ensure their patients receive the best possible care. \xe2\x80\x9cI take great pride in doing this because we are the gatekeepers of these supplies. We all are working diligently to anticipate needs and keep our departments well stocked,\xe2\x80\x9d says Pam Dalton, supply chain technician at Fairview Park Hospital.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Lynn Dennis, supply chain director, echoes this sentiment. \xe2\x80\x9cWorking with our HCA Healthcare supply chain network allows us to work strategically with all our hospitals to provide proper supplies needed for patients. We do this every day, but especially during this crisis,\xe2\x80\x9d she says.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you to ALL HCA Healthcare supply chain colleagues for #CaringDuringCOVID19!
\xe2\x80\xa2
:camera_with_flash: (L-R): Pam Dalton, Clay Sellers, Gail Wimberly (RN), Brent Graham, Lynn Dennis

#PositiveImpact #SupplyChain #HealthcareHeroes'

b'As the #COVID19 pandemic sweeps the U.S., many HCA Healthcare colleagues are answering the call by shifting their expertise to provide a very different kind of care to a very different kind of patient.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Lisa, surgical first assistant, and Terry and Kelsey, certified scrub technologists, are normally in the operating room at affiliate Lakeview Regional Medical Center. In the dynamically evolving era of COVID-19, they are now utilizing their skillset in the sterilization process of mission-critical personal protective equipment (PPE) like goggles and shields.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cWhether I am sterilizing surgical instruments or goggles for hospital staff, my job is to ensure patient safety and the safety of my Lakeview family. Whatever needs to be done, you can count on us,\xe2\x80\x9d says Terry.
\xe2\x80\xa2
We are grateful to all colleagues who continue to work hard to provide a safe environment for caregivers and patients.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #PositiveImpact'

b'Thank you to @Ford for lending your manufacturing and engineering expertise to assemble and send 77,000 face shields to HCA Healthcare facilities. Your collaboration and action during #COVID19 is helping front line heroes save lives! We are #BetterTogether. #CaringDuringCOVID19'

b'The @cdcgov has issued a recommendation for citizens to use cloth face coverings in \xe2\x80\x9cpublic settings where other social distancing measures are difficult to maintain (e.g., grocery stores and pharmacies), especially in areas of significant community-based transmission.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
This is another step to help reduce the potential transmission of #COVID19, especially from people who show no symptoms.
\xe2\x80\xa2
We kindly remind members of our community to use non-medical reusable masks. Please do your part to help make sure medical grade masks stay in the hands of our healthcare professionals and caregivers as they continue #CaringDuringCOVID19.'

b'HCA Healthcare is proud to team up with @googlecloud to launch the COVID-19 National Response Portal. The platform will help U.S. hospitals safely share and display real-time #COVID19 data including ICU bed and ventilator utilization, testing results, and total number of patient visits to America\xe2\x80\x99s hospital systems.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cCOVID-19 presents a unique and significant challenge to healthcare providers, and collaboration and coordination is more important than ever to help ensure the best possible response,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dr. Edmund Jackson, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s chief data officer. \xe2\x80\x9cWhile COVID-19 has driven us apart physically, we will respond to it by coming together digitally. We are proud to work alongside Google Cloud to create a platform to help address this urgent public health challenge.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Click the :link: in bio to learn more.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HCATechnology #Data #DataSharing #Cloud'

b'The people who are fighting for us. HCA Healthcare ER nurse Courtney Callaway captured this quiet moment during a morning huddle at @methodisthealthcaresa.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cI love my coworkers, they are my family. I am proud to work with every single one of them,\xe2\x80\x9d said Courtney. \xe2\x80\x9cCOVID will not win this hospital nor San Antonio on our watch."

b':musical_notes: :speaker_low_volume: #SoundOn: During #COVID19, a nurse from #MusicCity is using music as medicine, encouraging nurses on the frontlines to keep their faith and hold tight.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Cia Constantine, who serves HCA Healthcare patients at Nashville\xe2\x80\x99s The Frist Clinic, woke up one morning and felt overwhelmingly compelled to pick up her guitar and turn her emotions in to words.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cEven though the song acknowledges these are anxious times, it also speaks to the hope that we are in it together and will be stronger once we get through it,\xe2\x80\x9d says Cia. \xe2\x80\x9cI needed a melody to sing over and over to remind myself of that, and I\xe2\x80\x99m so glad it is helping other nurses in the same way.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cIt has been incredible to see how everyone has come together at HCA Healthcare during this crisis,\xe2\x80\x9d adds Cia. \xe2\x80\x9cIt is really special to work for a team like this at a time where togetherness will mean everything.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you, Cia, for your service and for reminding us that we\xe2\x80\x99re all in this together.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #HCANursing'

b'THIS is the news that we all want to see. Armed with balloons and well-wishes, colleagues at @spotsrmc gathered in the hospital lobby to celebrate the discharge of their first COVID-19 positive patient.

Mr. Bryant and his family have become close with our HCA Healthcare family during his stay, and although he will be missed, we are excited for this next step in his recovery.

#FeelGoodFriday #CaringDuringCOVID19  #CareLikeFamily #COVID19 #GoodNews'

b'HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s Environmental Services (EVS) teams are working hard to serve and protect during the #COVID19 pandemic while you\xe2\x80\x99re helping to #FlattenTheCurve at home. Their work is critical to infection prevention and hospital efficiency.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cWe are in and out of patient rooms, making sure everything is clean and safe. A lot of patients are scared, but we are there for them,\xe2\x80\x9d says EVS tech, Tracy Sherman. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s important that we come in and they see our faces \xe2\x80\x93 especially since their family members are unable to visit at this time. Sometimes we are the first people a patient sees, and they are excited to see a smiling face walking through the door.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Of his 130+ team, EVS Director Kevin Radford adds, \xe2\x80\x9cOne way or another, somehow, somebody on this team always allows me to know that it\xe2\x80\x99s worthwhile. This is my family.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you, EVS teams, for being a beacon of hope during this national pandemic. :camera_with_flash:: Grand Strand Medical Center EVS team
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily'

b'When we say #CareLikeFamily, we mean it. This past Wednesday, a group of HCA Healthcare nurses from Kansas City arrived in New Orleans to lend a hand to fellow nurses in need at sister-facility Tulane Medical Center.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Louisiana\xe2\x80\x99s governor had put out a call for doctors and nurses in other parts of the country, not so hard hit by the virus, to volunteer their service. Many out-of-state HCA Healthcare nurses vowed to answer the call.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cWithout a doubt, the response was yes,\xe2\x80\x9d said HCA Healthcare regional vice president of nursing operations, Suzanne Ford. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ll do it. What plane you want to put me on? Right now, we have about 20 volunteers that will be rotating through between this week and next. We do have 200 nurses that volunteered.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cI just feel like I am meant to be here,\xe2\x80\x9d nurse volunteer Aliyah Haynes adds. \xe2\x80\x9cI am meant to help. I was just so sure that I wanted to come here.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Click the :link: in bio for the full story.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #YearOfTheNurse #HCANursing'

b':blue_heart:What you do today matters.
:orange_heart: We\xe2\x80\x99re all in this together.
:blue_heart:There\xe2\x80\x99s a rainbow at the end of this storm.
:orange_heart:You are a hospital hero.

These sweet messages of encouragement, support and love were written on the sidewalk and windows of caregiver entrances at affiliate @memorial_health by the hospital\xe2\x80\x99s child life specialists. Child life specialists are used to helping children within the hospital get through tough times, so cheering on their fellow HCA Healthcare colleagues on the frontlines of #COVID19 was natural.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Katie Bladergroen, child life specialist says: \xe2\x80\x9cI think there is just simple things that humans can do for each other that really goes a long way, and this is one of those things. Knowing that maybe it caused some smiles as people were entering their shift means a lot to all of us.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cI am so proud and grateful to work for an organization that truly cares like family, said Kristen King, child life manager. \xe2\x80\x9cDuring this difficult time, our leadership, colleagues and community recognize the need to support, inspire and encourage each other \xe2\x80\x93 which is remarkable.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
To the child life specialists at Memorial Health and across HCA Healthcare, thank you for each and every smile you bring to others.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #PositiveImpact'

b'In the midst of #COVID19, Stacie Miller, a chief nursing officer with @methodisthealthcaresa, wrote a moving piece about the selfless dedication of our nurses and how they continue to exemplify Florence Nightingale\xe2\x80\x99s principles 200 years later.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cDuring this trying time it is nurses that are on the front lines, walking into the unknown once again, to selflessly minister to the sick with an endless supply of compassion. We may not carry lamps through dark hallways but we are the light to a scared and anxious community \xe2\x80\x93 a calming force in the midst of an unpredictable storm,\xe2\x80\x9d says Stacie.

b'Raw moments of humanity and resilience are shining through the cracks of the COVID-19 pandemic. We continue to send our gratitude to HCA Healthcare colleagues on the front lines. One of our heroes, nurse Baylie Mader from @tulanehealthsystem, took a moment after a shift to jot down what she was feeling.
\xe2\x80\xa2
BAYLIE: \xe2\x80\x9cMy face hurts from working in a COVID ICU every day this week, but it\xe2\x80\x99s reminder of how blessed I am to work at a hospital that provides the proper PPE to their staff and that is conserving PPE without putting their staff in unsafe working conditions. The circles under my eyes may have gotten darker as the days went on but I can ultimately say I had a good week at work. I will continue to be thankful through all of this because I have so much to be grateful for. The smallest things like proper protection are so very important and should never be taken for granted.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you, Baylie, for #CaringDuringCOVID19.

#HCANursing #YearOfTheNurse'

b'Some may say that managing life-threatening situations is part of business as usual for an advanced healthcare network like HCA Healthcare. And it\xe2\x80\x99s true.

As the threat from the COVID-19 virus is amplified, so too are our efforts. In the weeks ahead, and as always, we are here when you need us.

#Resilience #CaringDuringCOVID19'

b"Meet HCA Healthcare nurse, Amber Craig. As an emergency services manager at affiliate @westvalleymed, she\xe2\x80\x99s a real life superhero and is proud to come to work each day to care for YOU. Amber (right), took a moment to remind us of ways we can support heroes like her and make a difference in the battle against #COVID-19.
.

AMBER: \xe2\x80\x9cI am a nurse. In an ER. During a pandemic. I signed up for this, knowing that any moment my normal world could be turned upside down. I have an incredible team that I work with, and I brag on them regularly. The ones I want to tell you about are even more amazing. It's the unsung heroes at home.

This month has been trying. It's caused many tears, and a lot of lost sleep. I'm so blessed to spend my waking hours on the front line, because my family has been taken for granted, again.

My sister and family came to help with painting and home repairs, all I fed them was toast, thankfully she made soup.

My son completed his recognition day gauntlet and is no longer a knob. This, without any public attention or praise, he did with his team. He is now home safe, and pulling part of the weight I can't. Because, I chose to be a nurse.

My daughter sent me a message today that brought me to tears. She said she's proud of me. She's at home cooking and cleaning... Because I'm a nurse.

My parents bought and paid for my groceries yesterday. Not because my bank account can't handle it, but because they felt it was the least they could do since I'm a nurse and they're thankful... My brother's family brought my crew doughnuts to keep us running.

My husband has been my rock. He has wiped every tear, cooked and cleaned, repaired the house, balanced the budget, and given me encouragement. He hasn't complained that I'm never home, and supports his nurse.

I'm so very blessed to be a nurse, even more because I have this team behind me!\xe2\x80\x9d
.

Thank you to Amber, and all on the frontlines, for #CaringDuringCOVID19.

#COVID19 #HCANursing #YearOfTheNurse"

b'As the world steps back and stays home, HCA Healthcare nurses are stepping up.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Patrick Pabon, a @sarahcannoncancer nurse navigator, was asked to assist with COVID-19 screening after his regular work hours. He did not hesitate to offer his time to help his colleagues during this busy time \xe2\x80\x93 and not only helped with screening for three days, but also transported patients to their unit when needed.

#COVID19 #HealthierTomorrows'

b'#ICYMI Service dog in training, Wynn :paw_prints:, makes her debut on the @todayshow, sharing the story of how she\xe2\x80\x99s helping to comfort emergency department colleagues and first responders during the coronavirus pandemic.

\xe2\x80\x9cWe find such comfort in just getting to pet her and it grounds us,\xe2\x80\x9d @rosemedicalcenter emergency physician, Dr. Susan Ryan told TODAY. \xe2\x80\x9cThis just helps us remember to be human and connected. It just melts away the armor that we have put up to carry out our jobs.\xe2\x80\x9d

As #DoctorsDay comes to a close, we want to send a heartfelt thank you to Dr. Ryan, Wynn\xe2\x80\x99s volunteer puppy raiser, for #CaringDuringCOVID19 and continuing to help the public understand the importance of service animals.

b'These are the faces of our heroic respiratory therapists (RTs). During #COVID19, RTs play a vital role on the interdisciplinary team that is racing to save lives around the world.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Working in respiratory therapy means treating the related side effects of diseases, viruses and infections of the cardiopulmonary system. These conditions range from severe colds and pneumonia to asthma, bronchitis, emphysema, lung cancer and now\xe2\x80\xa6coronavirus.
\xe2\x80\xa2
For COVID-19 patients in respiratory distress, RTs use their expertise to help patients breathe with ventilators that deliver crucial oxygen to the lungs.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cIn my 38 years as a respiratory therapist, I\xe2\x80\x99ve never experienced anything like COVID-19 and the impact it\xe2\x80\x99s having on our community,\xe2\x80\x9d says Terri Billings, who works at affiliate @redmondregional in Georgia. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so proud of our fantastic team of respiratory therapists and the work they are doing every day on the front lines to make a difference in the lives of the patients we serve.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
To our entire respiratory team, thank you for being a keystone in the COVID-19 battle. We see your professionalism, hard work, sacrifice and dedication.

#CaringDuringCOVID19 #CareLikeFamily #PositiveImpact #RespiratoryTherapy'

b'Meet Matt Glynn. He\xe2\x80\x99s a laboratory manager at affiliate Alaska Regional Hospital and a #COVID19 hero that we are celebrating.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cOn the frontlines, we are caring for patients as if they are our own family members, and we are dedicated to providing the most accurate and timely diagnostic information for our wonderful healthcare providers,\xe2\x80\x9d says Matt, a medical technologist. \xe2\x80\x9cOur laboratory team is working diligently night and day and I\xe2\x80\x99m very proud of our laboratory team at Alaska Regional Hospital, as well as our entire HCA Healthcare family!\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Thank you to all of our lab teams for #CaringDuringCOVID19.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CareLikeFamily #PositiveImpact'

b'Hundreds of Georgia community members came together to hold a prayer circle around HCA Healthcare colleagues at affiliate @cartersvillemedical. From the safety of their own cars, families tuned in to a local radio station and lifted up heroes on the front lines of COVID-19 and those that are healing inside the hospital.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Standing in solidarity, a group of healthcare heroes greeted the packed parking lot from the roof of the hospital.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve never been more proud to work here in all the years that I\xe2\x80\x99ve worked here,\xe2\x80\x9d said Michele Anderson, a nurse and 26-year colleague at Cartersville Medical Center. \xe2\x80\x9cThe community outpouring is unbelievable.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
We\xe2\x80\x99re all in this together, and acts of kindness from our colleagues and communities prove that every day.

b'In times of uncertainty, one thing remains constant: the dedication of our doctors, nurses, and other frontline caregivers, as well as the colleagues who support them, in serving the health needs of our community.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Meet one of our heroes: Jackie Nettles, RN, at affiliate @nfrmcfl. As an organization, we remain focused on preparation efforts to prevent the spread of COVID-19 to our patients and colleagues to include restricted visitor access in our facilities. On Sunday, March 22 a patient\xe2\x80\x99s wife asked if she could \xe2\x80\x9cvisit\xe2\x80\x9d with her husband through the window. Jackie, a neuroscience nurse on 4 South brought the patient to the window of his room so that he could see his wife, who was on the sidewalk on the other side of Newberry Road with an "I Love You" sign. There wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a dry eye on the floor!
\xe2\x80\xa2
This small gesture made such a tremendous difference for this patient. This is just one example of how our colleagues are #CaringDuringCOVID19. Please join us in applauding Jackie and those who are working around-the-clock for our communities.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CareLikeFamily #COVID19'

b'At our core, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s greatest strength is our people. And, in these unprecedented times, the heart of each team member is shining through. Dietary services supervisor Aleshia Cooper \xe2\x80\x93 who recently celebrated her 20-year anniversary with affiliate @thewomanshosptx \xe2\x80\x93 is taking caring like family to a whole new level.
\xe2\x80\xa2
On top of the nutritious meals that Aleshia\xe2\x80\x99s food and nutrition team serves daily to colleagues, patients and visitors, her team is also preparing 500 sack lunches every day for our colleagues to take home to their children.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cGiving our colleagues one less thing to worry about when they get home after a 12-hour shift is a wonderful feeling. Being able to help them makes me happy and I know they are appreciative,\xe2\x80\x9d says Aleshia. \xe2\x80\x9cThis hospital team is my family, and we all care for each other like family. The Woman\xe2\x80\x99s Hospital of Texas, in particular, is a very happy place and I love it here. It\xe2\x80\x99s not a job to me.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
 #CaringDuringCOVID19 #COVID19'

b'Responding in times of crisis is what we do as an organization and what HCA Healthcare colleagues do as healthcare professionals. HCA Healthcare currently has adequate personal protective equipment supplies, and we are doing everything in our power to ensure we continue to have enough to protect our patient care colleagues.\n\xe2\x80\xa2\nLearn more about how we care for our HCA Healthcare family at the link in bio.'
b'Heroes work here. :hospital:@skyridgemedcolorado @healthonedenver\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n#CaringDuringCOVID19 #COVID19'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cI love helping people. I always have. We see people at their sickest and help them get better. When you work in an emergency room, you are the first people patients see when they come to a hospital for an emergency. It gives us instant gratification knowing that we get the chance to impact lives. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never had to deal with something like the coronavirus before. For the first time ever, we are also having to think about ourselves and our safety, instead of just the patients. Thankfully, we have the support and resources we need to care for these patients in the community. This experience has truly made us work together. We\xe2\x80\x99ve always worked as a team here at Westside, but this has definitely brought us closer. I\xe2\x80\x99m very confident in the team that I have here. We\xe2\x80\x99ve done a great job at handling strokes, heart attacks and other emergencies, so there is no reason why we wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be able to handle this crisis. We are aware that things may get worse and may push us even harder, but we will continue to wake up each day ready to give it our all.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 Dr. Jaroslaw Parkolap, Medical Director of Emergency Services at @westsideregional

Please join us in thanking Dr. Parkolap and all HCA Healthcare caregivers as they continue #CaringDuringCOVID19.

b'\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s an honor to be a nurse at HCA Healthcare, and I\xe2\x80\x99m so grateful to be a part of the Transfer Center team during a time like this. I am blown away by the proactive and positive attitudes my teammates have. In our pursuit of caring like family, we are here for one another, for our patients and for our frontline heroes. I\xe2\x80\x99m proud of the way our HCA Healthcare colleagues have come together, both locally and nationally, to continue serving our patients and clinical teams through what lies before us.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 Brad Ewton, RN, Transfer Center manager
\xe2\x80\xa2
As part of HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s Transfer Center team, Brad is dedicated to making sure that patients get the right care at the right place at the right time. He uses vital clinical and communication skills to help patients, many who are critically ill, with time sensitive diagnoses or complex needs.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cDuring this pandemic, HCA Healthcare Transfer Center nurses are working to support and protect our hospital team members and patients,\xe2\x80\x9d says Brad, who works out of our Mountain Division in Salt Lake City, Utah. \xe2\x80\x9cWe want our frontline colleagues to know we are here for you! The Transfer Center team strives to take the workload off of our hospital physicians and nurses in coordinating vital patient movement, so they can focus on caring for our patients and supporting their own teams. In order to identify those affected or at risk of  COVID-19, we are screening every patient that transfers into one of our sites of care. This enables us to alert our clinical teams pre-arrival to ensure patient and staff safety measures can be in place.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CaringDuringCOVID19 #HCANursing #YearOfTheNurse'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cWhile our in-hospital colleagues continue to carry out their compassionate and courageous duty to care for and improve human life, it\xe2\x80\x99s important for those that are at home during COVID-19 to keep perspective and carry on,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dr. Frank Drummond, HCA Healthcare\xe2\x80\x99s medical director of behavioral health services. \xe2\x80\x9cWe can do this by taking care of our mental health during this challenging moment in history. Reach out to check on the well-being of others, practice self-care, engage in activities that give you purpose and stay calm.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
We\xe2\x80\x99re all in this together and even the smallest steps can make a big difference.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Follow the link in bio to learn more about the @cdcgov\xe2\x80\x99s guidance on mental health and coping during the coronavirus outbreak.

#COVID_19 #MentalHealth #HealthierTomorrows #SelfCare'

b'HCA Healthcare Emergency Services Director Krista Hawkinson becomes emotional as she stands outside her hospital, JFK Medical Center. In a rallying cry of support, community members brought care packages to the emergency department and countless messages for healing hands.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cThis world can be harsh, it can be dark, but there is so much light and hope for the future,\xe2\x80\x9d Krista said. \xe2\x80\x9cThis unbelievable gesture by our community gave our staff an incredible understanding of their worth within the community. We will fight this virus, we will fulfill our honor and duty to care for others, we will be here for our community, we will do everything possible for our patients and families and we will be here for each other. We are privileged to be trusted caregivers during a crisis and we are blessed to serve a community like ours!\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
To Krista, and all HCA Healthcare colleagues on the front lines, thank you for #CaringDuringCOVID19.
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CareLikeFamily #EmergencyServices #COVID_19'

b'According to the @american_heart, only about 10% of people who experience an out-of-hospital cardiac arrest survive.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Basketball legend Dave Corless is one of the lucky ones. Thanks to the quick action and teamwork of good Samaritans, first responders and HCA Healthcare caregivers, Dave is here to celebrate his 48th wedding anniversary.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Earlier this week, more than 100 people reunited at affiliate Trident Medical Center :hospital: to wish Dave continued success in his recovery.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cThis is a team sport and it takes everybody coming together to make these extraordinary acts happen,\xe2\x80\x9d said Trident Health\xe2\x80\x99s president and chief executive officer, Todd Gallati, during the event. \xe2\x80\x9cOur first responders are very important to our hospital and we have someone in this room who is very, very lucky that they did what they did.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
For Trident Health radiology technologist, Kristy Blanco, the reunion hit close to home. Dave is her dad.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cMy HCA Healthcare family provides compassionate care every day. But, to see them provide that care to my dad has given me a greater level of appreciation for the work they do,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kristy. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve never been more proud of my hospital family.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
#CareLikeFamily #HeartMonth'

b'HCA Healthcare patient, Aaron Kendle, devoted 15 years of his life to the @usnavy SEALs special operations force. Specialized medic, sniper, airborne leader, and jump school instructor, Aaron never imagined an aortic aneurysm could ever threaten his life.

Aaron underwent a valve sparing aortic root replacement procedure at affiliate @methodisthealthcaresa under the steadfast care of aorta specialist, Dr. Kim de la Cruz. Having gone his whole medical career facing challenges and providing brave leadership, it was Aaron\xe2\x80\x99s turn to trust his life in Dr. de la Cruz\xe2\x80\x99s hands.

#WATCH Aaron\xe2\x80\x99s amazing story...
\xe2\x80\xa2
#HeartMonth #HealthierTomorrows #NavySEALs #Hero'

b'In a recent interview with HealthLeaders Media, Jane D. Englebright, senior vice president and chief nurse executive for HCA Healthcare, shares the results of a new nursing study and discusses what nurse leaders should know regarding the needs of millennial and Gen Z nurses.

b'This just in: HCA Healthcare is excited to release findings from a new study that surveyed Millennial and Gen Z nurses to better understand what drives, engages and motivates the new generations of nurses entering the profession.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cEvery day, nurses make a tremendous contribution to delivering a high-quality patient care experience, and it\xe2\x80\x99s incumbent on health system leaders to help new nurses navigate opportunities and thrive,\xe2\x80\x9d said Jane D. Englebright, senior vice president and chief nurse executive for HCA Healthcare.

b'As the @chiefs celebrate a Super Bowl victory, @hcamidwest Health leaders came together for the Leadership Development Institute (LDI) to learn, grow and celebrate their city. \xe2\x80\x9cWinning the Super Bowl is 50 years in the making,\xe2\x80\x9d said says Mel Lagarde, President of HCA MidAmerica Division, which includes HCA Midwest. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s no better way to celebrate our city and honor our leaders, than to host none other than the Kansas City Chiefs\xe2\x80\x99 Mascot, KC Wolf, Dan Meers and learn about his story.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
 Meers was a patient at affiliate Centerpoint Medical Center :hospital: following a tragic accident in 2013 when he fell from the sky, practicing his KC Wolf game entrance on a zip line bungee jump stunt. \xe2\x80\x9cI have always strived to live my life with purpose, character and passion. Because of the compassionate care delivered by the team at Centerpoint Medical Center, I am able to continue to live my life\xe2\x80\x99s mission, while also making the world a brighter place. The Super Bowl win in Miami on Sunday was one of the top ten moments in my life and I was able to be there because of the outstanding care I received,\xe2\x80\x9d says Meers.
\xe2\x80\xa2
 While Meers kicked off the Kansas City Chiefs\xe2\x80\x99 famous \xe2\x80\x9cTomahawk Chop\xe2\x80\x9d at LDI, Lagarde says, \xe2\x80\x9cThis is something we will never forget \xe2\x80\x93 a Super Bowl win, and our leaders coming together to hear one of our very own patients, KC Wolf provide us a victory celebration and inspiration for our mission:  above all else, we are committed to the care and improvement of human life.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
#HealthierTomorrows #WellnessWednesday'

b'Orthopedic surgeons Dr. Keith Merrill and Dr. Haley Merrill are the ultimate father-daughter duo. They bond over healing patients in the operating room at affiliate Trident Medical Center.

When Haley told her father she wanted to follow in his footsteps, he was ecstatic. \xe2\x80\x9cI just wanted her to be happy doing whatever she wanted to do,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\xa2
Dr. Haley Merrill can often be found teaching her dad new things or showing him the latest studies. \xe2\x80\x9cSeeing my daughter at work has inspired me to become a better doctor,\xe2\x80\x9d says Dr. Keith Merrill. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s so gratifying to see her at work and I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t be more proud. She gets along with everybody and truly has a heart for the patients in our community.\xe2\x80\x9d

#PositiveImpact #CareLIkeFamily #GirlDad'

b'Caregivers at affiliate @henricodoctorshospital :hospital: recently launched the first autism and sensory-friendly pediatric ER and hospital in Central Virginia for children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD).
\xe2\x80\xa2
The newly designed rooms provide pediatric patients with sensory concerns specific features and services including: step-by-step procedure pictures to let patients know what to expect, a dimmer switch on overhead LED lighting, a calming light projector, sensory cart filled with calming toys :teddy_bear: and products, weighted blankets and noise canceling headphones :headphone: and more.
\xe2\x80\xa2
In 2018 the @cdcgov determined that approximately 1 in 59 children is diagnosed with an autism spectrum disorder. :jigsaw:
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cFor these families to know that they have a place to go where the staff has been trained, where there\xe2\x80\x99s special equipment to help patients feel more comfortable, helps patients and the family feel more at ease when an emergency arises,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dr. Kevin Connelly, medical director of the pediatric emergency department at Henrico Doctors\xe2\x80\x99 Hospital.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Today and every day, HCA Healthcare invites you to show support for the millions of amazing children, men and women living with ASD. And a special thank you to our innovative caregivers, like Dr. Connelly, who are on the front lines, raising the bar for autism awareness and acceptance. :blue_heart:
\xe2\x80\xa2
#PositiveImpact #RaiseTheBar #HCAChildrens #AutismAwareness'

b'We recently celebrated :party_popper:Kristin\xe2\x80\x99s fourth and final chemotherapy treatment at affiliate @henricodoctorshospital :hospital:, a part of @sarahcannoncancer network.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Kristin is not only a patient, but a HCA Healthcare colleague. As a physician and provider relations director, she is known as HCA Virginia\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cMammo Queen\xe2\x80\x9d. Kristin led the efforts behind the creation of \xe2\x80\x9cMammo and Massage\xe2\x80\x9d parties, encouraging routine mammography screens and promoting breast cancer prevention year-after-year.
\xe2\x80\xa2
Today we know Kristin as a strong and resilient fighter:flexed_biceps:. Her courage and positivity over the last few months has never faltered and she continues to amaze us all with that beautiful smile!
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\x9cThe aggressive type of breast cancer that I have, triple negative, is strongly tied to women under 50, African American women and those that are BRCA positive. I am none of those,\xe2\x80\x9d says Kristin. \xe2\x80\x9cMy journey has been made easier because I had a mammogram last year and then felt it just before my next annual. Getting tested minimized the time it had to grow.\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
Kristin wants to remind everyone that now :spiral_calendar: is a great time to make your New Year\xe2\x80\x99s resolution count: \xe2\x80\x9cPlease check your breasts for lumps, discharge, tissue thickening, dimpling or any changes. Also get that mammogram!\xe2\x80\x9d
\xe2\x80\xa2
#FightingCancerTogether #CareLikeFamily #BreastCancerAwareness'
